I would like to clarify the relationship between parameters exposed in this patch and NullPool.

In addition, (though it is not a part of this patch) it may be better to move database parameters to quantum.conf from plugin-specific config file since all plugins use database and all of them have the same entries except the example sql_connection. The number of plugins increases and moving the common parameters to quantum.conf will reduce the maintenance cost. I don't know the background why the database parameters are defined in plugin-specific config files instead of quantum.conf."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-10 16:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Expose most common QueuePoll parameters from SQLAlchemy

Fixes bug 1160442

The defualt parameters are used unless otherwise configured. This
is applicable for:
 - pool_size
 - max_overflow
 - pool_timeout

By increasing the pool_size and the max_overflow and lowering the timeout
the issue reported in the bug is resolved.

NOTE: the configuration values enable the user to make use of the default
QueuePool tuning values.

Change-Id: Ic258442531a2caf2db4f05c4ddd6fbfb0c180f17

commit_message:
Hide lock_prefix argument using synchronized_with_prefix()

The lockfile module has a new convenience API which sets the lockfile prefix.
Using this API, the prefix is not required everytime synchronized is used.
This enables for projects to have consistant prefixes on their lockfiles

Change-Id: I4bc3f28a9ed2a6e2438a90f163bbde081211062c

[{'created': '2013-03-11 14:02:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add RABBIT_DURABLE_QUEUE (default True) for glance api.

Default value True, sets rabbit_durable_queues = True in glance-api.conf
Fixes: bug #1087131.

Change-Id: I004b249f106d5837deeccd8bcf5d150e1c361f84
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>
'}]
commit_message:
Add RABBIT_DURABLE_QUEUE (default True) for glance api.

Default value True, sets rabbit_durable_queues = True in glance-api.conf
Fixes: bug #1087131.

Change-Id: I004b249f106d5837deeccd8bcf5d150e1c361f84
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>

I can't remember; has the code for evacuate actually merged in nova?  If not, please add a link to that review to the commit message…"}, {'account_id': 7094, 'date': '2013-05-29 05:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kevin,
I did submit a pull request for it to be merged in Nova but the approach changed after the summit and it got abandoned https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25259/.
The approach of moving it out of api and putting it in the client is inspired by the discussion -> http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-April/007646.html'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-05-29 09:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

So that seems to make sense.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-05-29 16:18:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

It looks like all of the tests were moved so you're going to need to rebase.  And I have an inline comment about output."}, {'account_id': 2667, 'date': '2013-05-29 19:12:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Very useful, but it should rather use the scheduled rather than targeted option. Specifying single target host would typically fail after evacuating part of the instances  -- what are the chances that it happens to have enough capacity??"}, {'account_id': 7094, 'date': '2013-06-03 09:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7094, 'date': '2013-06-03 09:59:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Andrew: I rebased it with master but doesn't look like any tests have moved.
I've incorporated the suggestion about the output being printed as a table.

Alex: I've created https://blueprints.launchpad.net/python-novaclient/+spec/find-and-evacuate-host for the same. Looks like it's going to be blocked until https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/find-host-and-evacuate-instance is merged.
Also, in some cases, we do have a spare host with full capacity available. I agree it is doesn't help if you do not have such a host, but for now it's a good start."}, {'account_id': 2667, 'date': '2013-06-03 10:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

OK, fair enough, but I would suggest making sure that the transition to the scheduled scenario is as easy as making the destination host optional (e.g., might make sense to extend the output to include the destination host.. not sure if there is anything else). One more thought: in some cases the provider might want to distinguish between instances that need to be evacuated and instances that don't  -- e.g., based on corresponding instance property 'HA=true'. Would be good to make it easy supporting such option by adding an extra argument to the command (e.g., add 'selection criteria' argument, and just support 'all' at the moment)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-03 10:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

I like the suggestion of making sure the destination host is optional.  If it's not in nova yet, there's no reason to block this for it, though.

As for the extra criteria ... I think we should consider that out of scope.  That kind of thing is why the lower level operations are the actual nova APIs.  You would just need to write your own app to evacuate based on your own criteria.  Evacuating an entire host seems like a good thing for us to ship, since it's relatively straight forward and is the majority use case, anyway."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-03 14:30:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Evacuate each instance from one host to another

Added a new extension that adds the ability for admins to evacuate an
entire host to another host. This internally uses the
existing server.evacuate api.
The target host is optional so that a free host will be chosen by the
scheduler in the api.
Implements: blueprint evacuate-host

Change-Id: I2352836d01952e281e15edb9bdd1b912106516d6

Hi, I have a few suggested tweaks. In particular the commit message is a bit opaque - remember that it communicates to our future selves why we did the change and what we intended.

I would make it say """Export volume metadata to new instances.

Instances that are booted from volume currently miss out on glance metadata that instances booted from images receive. By extracting that data and passing it on in the create request we make it available to both sorts of instance boot, fixing bug 1175571.

Change-Id: I8c01ba3065a909ca8e1805db9a10a423b10fe289
"""'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-05-31 21:05:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-05-13 15:38:01.000000000', 'message': 'Use metadata from volume on instance

This patch configures the compute API to take the metadata passed
from the volume api and add it to the instance. This means that
metadata contained within a glance image and passed to a cinder
volume will also be passed to an instance booted from that volume.

I realise that there are no tests submitted with this patch,
they will follow however I would appreciate comments on this
approach.

Fixes bug 1175571

Change-Id: I8c01ba3065a909ca8e1805db9a10a423b10fe289

commit_message:
Export volume metadata to new instances.

Instances that are booted from volume currently miss out on glance
metadata that instances booted from images receive. By extracting
that data and passing it on in the create request we make it
available to both sorts of instance boot, fixing bug 1175571.

Change-Id: I8c01ba3065a909ca8e1805db9a10a423b10fe289

commit_message:
Switch deprecated rabbit_notifier to rpc_notifier

The 'nova.openstack.common.notifier.rabbit_notifier' is deprecated since
the G release of Openstack, it has to be replaced with
'nova.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier'.

Change-Id: I2174bc1b6504bacfeb427b2f5b8f8dc19c167dcb

commit_message:
Make sample configs more readable.

Inject some empty lines to avoid the wall-of-text effect and to make
it a little clearer which descriptions go with which options.

Change-Id: I58914b83dad76ea5ca330903a246bee7ffaeba83

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible octal literal notation

0o755 is accepted by Python 2.6 and newer (did not
check older versions)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-10 04:28:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update Chef dependency to Chef 11

Also add dependency on json <= 1.7.7, required by Chef 11.

Resolves problem: Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem
"json" (required for chef and berkshelf).

Partial fix for bug #1183540

Change-Id: Ibabe5d0afc7dcfc9871197b889b11f84e18be250
'}]
commit_message:
Update Chef dependency to Chef 11

Also add dependency on json <= 1.7.7, required by Chef 11.

Resolves problem: Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem
"json" (required for chef and berkshelf).

Partial fix for bug #1183540

Change-Id: Ibabe5d0afc7dcfc9871197b889b11f84e18be250

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-06 19:42:57.000000000', 'message': 'Source functions in rejoin-stack.sh

stackrc loads localrc and localrc can use functions
like enable_service and disable_service. Make sure
the functions are defined before loading stackrc.

Change-Id: Ied7bbe0d228f252902cc491b8db0738c5071f06b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Source functions in rejoin-stack.sh

stackrc loads localrc and localrc can use functions
like enable_service and disable_service. Make sure
the functions are defined before loading stackrc.

Change-Id: Ied7bbe0d228f252902cc491b8db0738c5071f06b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Initial mariadb support

mariadb only differs in the package name from the mysql,
an already installed mariadb should not cause hangup in a
devstack installation.

Fixing Bug 1184722

Change-Id: I3b9d02b703e49044999ff1b9f1195ffcaf1d0cec

commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible octal literals

Python 3.x deprecated the 0700 construct. 0o700
works with any version of Python (>= 2.6 tested)

Change-Id: I47fcb79804b75437e6cf4ce966fbfdc05fce26cd

commit_message:
raise an UnknownUserParameter exception when receiving an unknown param

add some validation logic to Parameters, so that when an invalid param
is passed in an exception will be raised.

Fixes bug #1186790

Change-Id: I8aece556d8fc5cd5533f4baf041e345bdc5722ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-10 06:30:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for protocol numbers

This patch adds support for passing in protocol numbers into the API.
For example, 1 instead of ICMP. This allows all protocols besides
just TCP/UDP/ICMP to be used. This patch includes changes to support
this for the NVP Plugin. Existing plugins using securitygroups_rpc_base
and OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver require no change to leverage this.

Implements blueprint security-group-rules-protocol-numbers

Change-Id: I7d3b6986d9d0dadbefac0ea7798475a573dac046
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for protocol numbers

This patch adds support for passing in protocol numbers into the API.
For example, 1 instead of ICMP. This allows all protocols besides
just TCP/UDP/ICMP to be used. This patch includes changes to support
this for the NVP Plugin. Existing plugins using securitygroups_rpc_base
and OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver require no change to leverage this.

Implements blueprint security-group-rules-protocol-numbers

Change-Id: I7d3b6986d9d0dadbefac0ea7798475a573dac046

commit_message:
Ignore the .update-venv directory.

It appears to be made when you resume a broken venv creation.
It is listed in oslo's pep8 exclude list and .gitignore.

Change-Id: I3db570c778ca9c6e0df72f5512ed1a9c643ecb38

commit_message:
Add option OVS_PHYSICAL_INTERFACE to add physical port

Add physical interface to ovs physical bridge if using VLANs for
tenant networks or if using flat or VLAN provider networks.

Change-Id: I39dd3e18fcc0b917a9020b2aadbe1ba80f366d07

Although this does provide volumes to VMs, this is a different mechanism.  Cinder provides block storage based volumes and I'm not sure Cinder is the right place for this, as it fundamentally alters the scope of Cinder."}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2013-05-21 04:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Per Walter A. Boring IV's review "... I'm not sure Cinder is the right place for this, as it fundamentally alters the scope of Cinder,"  we've discussed this with cinder-core several times and have refactored the code significantly to tailor to their guidance.

To quote from spec for this blueprint:

"A variety of deployer driven requirements advocating for this expanded capability have informed our efforts. Cinder provides proven existing support common to the task of provisioning storage regardless of protocol type. Concepts such as capacity, target (server in NAS parlance), initiator (likewise the client when referring to shared file systems) are common. Specific Cinder capabilities (such as the filter scheduler, the notion of type, and extra specs) likewise apply to provisioning shared file systems as well."

The original role for nova-volume (and now Cinder) was to provide a persistence model for data.  Shared file systems can similarly provide for data persistence.'}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-05-21 10:36:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-21 11:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Being unsubtle with my approach here, but I've been promised that somebody not from netapp (so and one of gluster, lustre, gpfs, pfs) will be found to review this code and confirm that the approach looks suitable for them. Will gladly remove this -2 once that review appears."}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2013-05-23 20:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-06-02 16:22:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm still torn on what to do here.  I feel that adding a new service to Cinder as a means to short cut the incubation process is not the right thing to do.

I also don't want to just *ignore* this work that you've done.  I had hoped that the time and effort spent would have gone to actually creating a proper service/project.  We need to reach a concensus next week and move forward one direction or the other.  If that ends up being Cinder, so be it but there has to be a better way of moving this in than thousands of lines of code all at once."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-06-02 17:24:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I'll not talk about the moral aspects here, but yes, I agree a multi-thousand line patch is a reviewer's nightmare. Part of the rationale behind keeping this as a single-patch so far is it is _very_ difficult to maintain such a feature implemented in a dozen patches _across_ releases. Rebasing/merging will be a pain, more so in case where the future of this patch is hazy. If we reach a decision soon, I can see some splits I can make of this patch: e.g. separating it into something like 1. API part 2. DB part 3. Multi-backend/filter scheduler support addition for shares


Another improvement I can think of is creating a new class FilterSchedulerWithShares, and keep all the shares-related filter-scheduler code there (which will also inherit volume-related scheduler code), so that the code in class FilterScheduler remain clean for people not bothered about shares service."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-10 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-10 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-20 20:14:05.000000000', 'message': 'Shares service in Cinder

Change-Id: I119bfbd62c237314238026b7f80d8eecc602202d
'}, {'created': '2013-05-20 20:16:19.000000000', 'message': "Share service support in Cinder.

This patch introduces 'Shares' support in Cinder. A new service cinder-shares
will allow creation of file shares and other related operations. List of
operations currently supported:
1. Create/delete a file share
2. Create/delete snapshot of a share
3. Create share from snapshot
4. Provide/deny access to a share for a particular IP/IPs
5. List shares/snapshots/access-list

Reference LVM implementation for NFS and CIFS share drivers is provided. The
LVM share driver utilises NFS or CIFS helper to create shares. For CIFS, two
helpers: CIFSHelper, and CIFSNetConfHelper are included, the latter one
is implemented keeping in mind low interference  with the system-wide Samba
daemon. A NetApp 7-mode share driver is also included.

Another big thing included in this patch is filter-scheduler and multi-backend
support for shares. So users can now define multiple share backends with an
enabled_share_backends flag in cinder.conf, and then define flags in the
corresponding config group, to make intelligent decisions based on filter
scheduler to provision shares on multiple backends.

Care has been taken to separate the code as much from the volume service code
as possible. Also, the code is made to work very similar to how volumes work,
so that it becomes very easy to add advanced features similar to ones which
exist for volumes (e.g. share types, retry-and-reschedule for shares, etc)

Implements blueprint file-shares-service

DocImpact
......... ......... ......... ......... ......... ......... ......... .........|

Change-Id: I119bfbd62c237314238026b7f80d8eecc602202d

4. Provide/deny access to a share for a particular IP/IPs
5. List shares/snapshots/access-list

Reference LVM implementation for NFS and CIFS share drivers is
provided. The LVM share driver utilises NFS or CIFS helper to
create shares. For CIFS, two helpers: CIFSHelper, and
CIFSNetConfHelper are included, the latter one is implemented
keeping in mind low interference  with the system-wide Samba
daemon. A NetApp 7-mode share driver is also included.

Another big thing included in this patch is filter-scheduler
and multi-backend support for shares. So users can now define
multiple share backends with an enabled_share_backends flag in
cinder.conf, and then define flags in the corresponding config
group, to make intelligent decisions based on filter scheduler
to provision shares on multiple backends.

Care has been taken to separate the code as much from the volume
service code as possible. Also, the code is made to work very
similar to how volumes work, so that it becomes very easy to add
advanced features similar to ones which exist for volumes (e.g.
share types, retry-and-reschedule for shares, etc)

Implements blueprint file-shares-service

DocImpact

Change-Id: I119bfbd62c237314238026b7f80d8eecc602202d

commit_message:
Share service support in Cinder.

This patch introduces 'Shares' support in Cinder. A new service
cinder-shares will allow creation of file shares and other
related operations. List of operations currently supported:
1. Create/delete a file share
2. Create/delete snapshot of a share
3. Create share from snapshot
4. Provide/deny access to a share for a particular IP/IPs
5. List shares/snapshots/access-list

Reference LVM implementation for NFS and CIFS share drivers is
provided. The LVM share driver utilises NFS or CIFS helper to
create shares. For CIFS, two helpers: CIFSHelper, and
CIFSNetConfHelper are included, the latter one is implemented
keeping in mind low interference  with the system-wide Samba
daemon. A NetApp 7-mode share driver is also included.

Another big thing included in this patch is filter-scheduler
and multi-backend support for shares. So users can now define
multiple share backends with an enabled_share_backends flag in
cinder.conf, and then define flags in the corresponding config
group, to make intelligent decisions based on filter scheduler
to provision shares on multiple backends.

Care has been taken to separate the code as much from the volume
service code as possible. Also, the code is made to work very
similar to how volumes work, so that it becomes very easy to add
advanced features similar to ones which exist for volumes (e.g.
share types, retry-and-reschedule for shares, etc)

Implements blueprint file-shares-service

DocImpact

Change-Id: I119bfbd62c237314238026b7f80d8eecc602202d

commit_message:
Allow update_subnet to remove the gateway_ip.

We are allowed to pass None as a gateway_ip for a subnet, which
indicates that there is no gateway. This is the logic found in
create_subnet. Unfortunately update_subnet does not check for this
case, and forces a validation on the gateway_ip which will always
fail.

Bug: http://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1185518
Change-Id: Icd0f5e292431ef75795759f4a94cadb43ea2d043
Signed-off-by: Adin Scannell <adin@scannell.ca>

(2 inline comments)

I haven't had the time to do a deep dive, here, but some initial thoughts:

It looks like the SuffixExpireWorker runs serially after the AuditorWorker, yet they do very similar directory traversal.  So there will be two (expensive) directory traversals per auditor pass.  I think you want to merge the hash-expiration work inside the directory traversal already being done by AuditorWorker.

Other than that, there's a few tactical things inline (it looks like there's a lot of parens used with if statements which isn't Pythonic)."}, {'account_id': 4234, 'date': '2012-09-14 07:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-14 07:42:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

Hi Darrell

I appreciate your review again.

To according to your comments and improve the implementaion,
I changed this patch as bellow.

Modify directory traversal codes including util.audit_location_generator() and replicator.hash_suffix().
I guess duplicate traversal is avoided in this patch.

And update of hashes.pkl is minimized.
It happens only once to each partition and update is skipped if there is no change.

Finally lock are removed. 
I understand util.write_pickle() write to a temp file and then move it, so I decided to remove them.

Best regards,
  You Yamagata'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-10-04 23:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(bump to prevent expiry)'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-10-08 02:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You should probably include documentation for the config var, "suffix_expiration_reclaim_age" which includes something about it doing the same thing as "reclaim_age" in the object-replicator config.  In fact, maybe they should both be "reclaim_age" to make it more clear that they affect the same thing.  Deployers will probably want those two settings to have the same value.

[{'created': '2012-08-16 03:36:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add object-xauditor to fix bug/971914

This additional auditor manage expiration of suffix in hashes.pkl
to fix #971914 "Auditor doesn't recognize missing files".
It stores expiration date to hashes_expire.pkl and
recalculates hash values of expired suffix.
If files are lost by any trouble, hash value will be changed,
then replication will be triggered to recover them.

Change-Id: Id8aff3cc7553c704db837dab636fc19ef3e1db54

'}, {'created': '2012-09-10 04:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add suffix expiration check to object-auditor

(Only change title and comment)

This functionality manages expiration of suffix in hashes.pkl
to fix #971914 "Auditor doesn't recognize missing files".
It stores expiration date to hashes_expire.pkl and
recalculates hash values if the suffixes are expired.
If files are lost by any trouble, hash value will be changed,
then replication will be triggered to recover them.

This functionality can be enable or disable by config file.
And expire_age can be also set by it.

Note:
  This was originally implemented as an indepent process
  named object-xauditor.
  But this was integrated to object-auditor according to
  a reviewer's comment.

Change-Id: Id8aff3cc7553c704db837dab636fc19ef3e1db54

'}, {'created': '2012-12-03 04:18:05.000000000', 'message': "Add suffix hash recalc to object-auditor.

To fix #971914, this patch add suffix_hash_recalc_enable option.
If enable it, all suffix hashes value are recalculated and
hashes.pkl files are rebuilt at 'ALL' auditor_type mode.

To estimate the impact to performance, I measured the processing
time in SAIO enviroment with 'daemonize = False',
'files_per_second=1000', 'bytes_per_second=1000000000',
64KB/2265 objects.

If there is no change in hashes.pkl (best case),
no update to hashes.pkl happens.
So the impact to processing time is very slight.

If removed all hashes.pkl files (worst case), all hashes.pkl are
updated. So it was 8 times slower.

[no change in all partitons (hashes.pkl are not updated)]
false:  6.2sec
true :  6.4sec

[remove all hashes.pkl (hashes.pkl are updated)]
false:  6.3sec
true : 46.5sec

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id8aff3cc7553c704db837dab636fc19ef3e1db54

"}, {'created': '2012-12-03 08:42:40.000000000', 'message': "Add suffix hash recalc to object-auditor.

To fix #971914, this patch add suffix_hash_recalc_enable option.
If enable it, all suffix hashes value are recalculated and
hashes.pkl files are rebuilt at 'ALL' auditor_type mode.

To estimate the impact to performance, I measured the processing
time in SAIO enviroment with 'daemonize = False',
'files_per_second=1000', 'bytes_per_second=1000000000',
64KB/2265 objects.

If there is no change in hashes.pkl (best case),
no update to hashes.pkl happens.
So the impact to processing time is very slight.

If removed all hashes.pkl files (worst case), all hashes.pkl are
updated. So it was 8 times slower.

[no change in all partitons (hashes.pkl are not updated)]
false:  6.2sec
true :  6.4sec

[remove all hashes.pkl (hashes.pkl are updated)]
false:  6.3sec
true : 46.5sec

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id8aff3cc7553c704db837dab636fc19ef3e1db54

commit_message:
Add suffix hash recalculation to object-auditor.

rebase and add minor fix.
---
To fix #971914, this patch add suffix_hash_recalc_enable option.
If enable it, all suffix hashes value are recalculated and
hashes.pkl files are rebuilt at 'ALL' auditor_type mode.

To estimate the impact to performance, I measured the processing
time in SAIO enviroment with 'daemonize = False',
'files_per_second=1000', 'bytes_per_second=1000000000',
64KB/2265 objects.

If there is no change in hashes.pkl (best case),
no update to hashes.pkl happens.
So the impact to processing time is very slight.

If removed all hashes.pkl files (worst case), all hashes.pkl are
updated. So it was 8 times slower.

[no change in all partitons (hashes.pkl are not updated)]
false:  6.2sec
true :  6.4sec

[remove all hashes.pkl (hashes.pkl are updated)]
false:  6.3sec
true : 46.5sec

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id8aff3cc7553c704db837dab636fc19ef3e1db54

commit_message:
Adds testcases to test_strutils.to_bytes()

The 'default' arg was intended for returning a default value
when the input has a valid unit name but no magnitude.
This patch adds cases to make sure refactoring on to_bytes()
doesn't break original behavior.

Change-Id: I1e31d3f3cbb81be656a3e67ae2479e0afd0d4b21

commit_message:
Fix broken link to object storage admin guide

As noted in the report, this was linking to the object storage admin
guide as if it was within the compute admin guide. An extra .. should
fix this.

**Needs backport to stable/grizzly

fixes bug 1188523

Change-Id: I22d8a3c3810557c9d8cb6fc998c53983736fd14c

commit_message:
Fixed Bug #1182195
Fixed the .pom bug ...
this bug was generated due to missing directory name and location
for generating the glossary related documents.

I believe that there is no need to change the .yaml files under the
Openstack-Infra repository. This should update the OpenStack glossary
by fixing the continous integration system for OpenStack Glossary.

Removed additional 'preProcess' and 'postProcess' tags as requested.

Change-Id: I91492dc8533b08d401b3f0fcd8e0180f9a1bb7be

That's a whole lot of "if" to base a strong disagreement upon.  I urge you to reconsider.

The latest release of the tablesorter plugin was shipped almost three full years ago.  I'm not saying there will never be another release, but it is not a fast-moving project by any observable means.

This patch set removes a couple of kludgey work-arounds in Horizon to the behaviour of the tablesorter, which is doubly good because the comments attached to the work-arounds are misleading.  If (and at this point, it's a big "if") a new version is shipped with the bug fixed, you'll have to pull out the work-arounds anyways.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-06-06 08:23:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2013-06-04 23:31:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make the multi-select button on the "Floating IPs" page work again

This was a result of a subtle off-by-one error in jquery.table-sorter.js
as used by Horizon; it builds a cache object for parsers based on
the table width, but tables in Horizon have an extra table header
styled up for use as a title field, which throws the indices off

it is only tickled when manually defining custom parsers for columns,
and was known about upstream, as there was code to compensate for
the observed behaviour.

Altering the third-party library to expressly ignore the 0th element
is simpler with no corner cases as far as Horizon is concerned.

Change-Id: I3338dd0cafd8271de6bf5d980359ed62c752ed98
Fixes: Bug 1187586
'}, {'created': '2013-06-06 19:08:08.000000000', 'message': 'Make the multi-select button on the "Floating IPs" page work again

This was a result of an assumption made by table-sorter.js, which
was parroted by Horizon; that there will only be one row of table
headers in a <thead> section.  Horizon uses two rows: one for the
"table title" and one for the individual table headings.

With the default settings to tablesorter(), this yielded an off-by-one
error when applying custom sorters (or parsers, depending on which
nomenclature you like, table-sorter.js uses two) to the table.

it is only tickled when manually defining custom parsers for columns,
and has been known about for a while, as there was code to compensate
for the observed behaviour.

Altering the xpath to omit the extra headers (and telling tablesorter
to do the same) yields the expected results.  I would personally
prefer to chain the results through .not(), but tablesorter only
provides support for xpath

Change-Id: I3338dd0cafd8271de6bf5d980359ed62c752ed98
Fixes: Bug 1187586
'}, {'created': '2013-06-06 19:11:53.000000000', 'message': 'Make the multi-select button on the "Floating IPs" page work again

This was a result of an assumption made by table-sorter.js, which
was parroted by Horizon; that there will only be one row of table
headers in a <thead> section.  Horizon uses two rows: one for the
"table title" and one for the individual table headings.

With the default settings to tablesorter(), this yielded an off-by-one
error when applying custom sorters (or parsers, depending on which
nomenclature you like, table-sorter.js uses two) to the table.

it is only tickled when manually defining custom parsers for columns,
and has been known about for a while, as there was code to compensate
for the observed behaviour.

Altering the xpath to omit the extra headers (and telling tablesorter
to do the same) yields the expected results.  I would personally
prefer to chain the results through .not(), but tablesorter only
provides support for xpath

Change-Id: I3338dd0cafd8271de6bf5d980359ed62c752ed98
Fixes: Bug 1186914
'}]
commit_message:
Make the multi-select button on the "Floating IPs" page work again

This was a result of an assumption made by table-sorter.js, which
was parroted by Horizon; that there will only be one row of table
headers in a <thead> section.  Horizon uses two rows: one for the
"table title" and one for the individual table headings.

With the default settings to tablesorter(), this yielded an off-by-one
error when applying custom sorters (or parsers, depending on which
nomenclature you like, table-sorter.js uses two) to the table.

it is only tickled when manually defining custom parsers for columns,
and has been known about for a while, as there was code to compensate
for the observed behaviour.

Altering the xpath to omit the extra headers (and telling tablesorter
to do the same) yields the expected results.  I would personally
prefer to chain the results through .not(), but tablesorter only
provides support for xpath

Change-Id: I3338dd0cafd8271de6bf5d980359ed62c752ed98
Fixes: Bug 1186914

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-10 01:20:39.000000000', 'message': "Quantum: under the hood details

Add a chapter in Network Admin guide that describes how the Open
vSwitch plugin and Linux bridging plugins configure the various
network devices on the compute and networking hosts.

All of the images and code are from Etsuji Nakai (Red Hat) from the
slides:

http://www.slideshare.net/enakai/how-quantum-configures-virtual-networks-under-the-hood

This content has been added to the docs with Etsuji's permission, and
he has been recorded as author of this commit.

Lorin added some supporting text and specified (guessed) at the config
file options.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/31704

Change-Id: Ie2ce069b025bde273c20c8324317af24ddd4d019
"}]
commit_message:
Quantum: under the hood details

Add a chapter in Network Admin guide that describes how the Open
vSwitch plugin and Linux bridging plugins configure the various
network devices on the compute and networking hosts.

All of the images and code are from Etsuji Nakai (Red Hat) from the
slides:

http://www.slideshare.net/enakai/how-quantum-configures-virtual-networks-under-the-hood

This content has been added to the docs with Etsuji's permission, and
he has been recorded as author of this commit.

Lorin added some supporting text and specified (guessed) at the config
file options.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/31704

Change-Id: Ie2ce069b025bde273c20c8324317af24ddd4d019

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-10 00:59:53.000000000', 'message': "Make 01-boot-stack support requirements.txt.

Updates install.d/01-boot-stack so that it looks in requirements.txt
as well as the older (legacy) tools/pip-requires files when
attempting to install dependencies for our client libraries.

This fixes a rather cryptic issue that crept in this morning
with quantumclient due to the fact that they just moved over
to use requirements.txt... this would essentially cause some
of the quantumclient dependencies to get incorrectly easy_install'ed and
thus have bad permissions (on some of the egg-info files).

Change-Id: I488be161c45408727adeceb26f1f5c6b1de01430
"}]
commit_message:
Make 01-boot-stack support requirements.txt.

Updates install.d/01-boot-stack so that it looks in requirements.txt
as well as the older (legacy) tools/pip-requires files when
attempting to install dependencies for our client libraries.

This fixes a rather cryptic issue that crept in this morning
with quantumclient due to the fact that they just moved over
to use requirements.txt... this would essentially cause some
of the quantumclient dependencies to get incorrectly easy_install'ed and
thus have bad permissions (on some of the egg-info files).

Change-Id: I488be161c45408727adeceb26f1f5c6b1de01430

commit_message:
This should be version 7.0.0

are still developing, we should not increment versions
until the release; at which point we will begin semver.

commit_message:
Tests for os-hypervisors API extension of Nova

Tests against following paths are added:
os-hypervisors
os-hypervisors/detail
os-hypervisors/%hyper_id
os-hypervisors/%hyper_name/servers
os-hypervisors/statistics
os-hypervisors/%hyper_id/uptime

Implements: blueprint nova-os-hypervisors-api-extension-test
Change-Id: Ia209b113d0193720b445385e0fe399b81f48bb4b

fix error default policy for create_project

change `admin_or_owner` to `admin_required`

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-06 09:31:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add the iscsi device check and exception processing.

Before downloading the image and executing the command "qemu-img convert",
check if the iSCSI device is still available via the command "hdparm -t <dev>".
This command will output something like "Timing buffered disk reads: 34 MB
in 3.10 seconds = 10.95 MB/sec", indicating the device read speed. Otherwise,
the output will give "Timing buffered disk reads: read() failed: Input/output
error" to show the device is not connected. If it is unavailable, there is
no need to download the image & "qemu-img convert" and an exception
VolumeDeviceUnavailable will be raised.

Fixed Bug1169290.

Change-Id: I133b4cc1bac493df073d42e240092cf2e6300454

commit_message:
Add the iscsi device check and exception processing.

Before downloading the image and executing the command "qemu-img convert",
check if the iSCSI device is still available via the command "sudo dd
if=<device> of=/dev/null count=1". This command will raise an exception with
the message "Input/output error", if the back-end storage is disconnected to
the cinder-volume node, so we use it to test the availability of the storage
device. If it is unavailable, there is no need to download the image &
"qemu-img convert" and an exception DeviceUnavailable will be raised.

Fixed Bug1169290.

Change-Id: I133b4cc1bac493df073d42e240092cf2e6300454

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names.

    Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
    to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files, and tools in the
    general world are growing intelligence about them.

    adding test-requirements.txt to quantumclient/openstack/common/setup.py per review instructions.

Change-Id: Ibf991b400bfbeb4222216649901586e01a0255b1
Fixes: bug #1179008

commit_message:
Change lazy='dynamic' to 'joined' in models_v2

Previously several models were defined with lazy='dynamic'. This would
then cause Ports.fixed_ips (or w/e was specified as dynamic) to be defined
as a AppenderQuery object and when accessed would query for the result.
Therefore in get_ports() for example, when fixed_ips was accessed
in _make_port_dict() we would be issuing an addition query to the database
to lookup the fixed_ips information.

This patch changes update_port/subnet() so that it keeps track of what
changed so it does not have to query the db for values it should already
know about.

This patch also adds a unit test for update_subnet() adding host routes
where there was missing code coverage.

Implements blueprint improve-db-performance

Change-Id: I0b2214604042a1fd362cbbf3fd70e31adf0ce279

commit_message:
Fixes list_snapshots and _with_details methods in snap XML client

Listing was not stripping outer 'snapshots' tag before return

Change-Id: Ic95ed3b9f3f5c164f191c2445be611db2135ca54
Fixes: bug #1177610

commit_message:
ensure no code merges to tempest/tests

because of the restructure, we've had past merges coming into
tempest/tests. Put a check in to stop this for safety. We can
pull it at havana release safely, but it will help us on reviews
during the rest of the cycle.

Change-Id: I0714cd6f06bb89660fb121ca2394a89fc0ee9cb5

(updated to fix pep8 ordering issue)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-09 07:54:32.000000000', 'message': 'Sync Qpid RPC fix from Oslo

Qpid cannot serialize dicts containing strings longer than 65535
characters.  This change syncs the fix from Oslo to Quantum.

Fixes bug 1175808

Change-Id: I48071abffa86e71727deed05aca08ac475cbaf05
'}]
commit_message:
Sync Qpid RPC fix from Oslo

Qpid cannot serialize dicts containing strings longer than 65535
characters.  This change syncs the fix from Oslo to Quantum.

Fixes bug 1175808

Change-Id: I48071abffa86e71727deed05aca08ac475cbaf05

commit_message:
Remove generic Exception when using assertRaises

This change fixes errors associated with H202 checks and enables H202
checks.

Change-Id: I28a48d1b58f2f1f6824ee4b45782a0c961fe9fb5

commit_message:
Cache "qemu-img info" calls.

We ask qemu regularly if the virtual size of a disk image has changed,
yet the only time it actually will is if we resize the image. We can
therefore cache this information.

This is done with a new bounded cache implementatin that sits in
nova.utils for now. If it ends up being used more generically, I will
move it into oslo.

Change-Id: I42e19e8741a20ffa0366040959846423bc7dc10c

commit_message:
Bump version of PBR.

PBR had an issue building sphinx autodocs, which was fixed between
0.5.11 and 0.5.12. Let's bump the minimum version so that docs build
properly!

Fixes bug 1186834

Change-Id: I069dcc3d170eefadc90206be2b3c46d605917cbb

commit_message:
Test cleanups for chefspec 1.3.0

ChefSpec 1.3.0 allows tests to evaluate guards.  Wired in
this cookbook to use that functionality.  Made tests a
bit clearer, and better utilize the block_storage_stubs.

Change-Id: Ib2e3ee8e00bdc5fb5dcda6b48beb0c405e9d8b92

commit_message:
Updated tests with guard support

ChefSpec just released the ability to test guards.  We had tests
which tested functionality incorrectly, due to chefspec not supporting
guards.  Updated quite a few tests to be clearer, and to test
when should and should not occur.  Also, removed some duplicate SuSE
tests in server_spec.rb.  The vendor tests should test differences,
not the exact same things as the main test.

Change-Id: Id9e8c4f6566ffb8910d98ddb6bf19f49412aa69c

commit_message:
Core part improvements.

* node group tmpl props are now copied to the node group
* imaage_id is now taken from cluster base default image id or specific one from node group

Change-Id: I141110fbe1ba9dbc2f82d5748af6cd8643c411ee

[{'created': '2013-06-08 00:30:38.000000000', 'message': 'Minor Logic bug in NFS Driver.

When checking oversubscription rate, we need to ensure that we
check the _allocated_ (apparant size) not the _available_ (actual
usage) on the NFS share.  This fix ensures we are now checking the
correct values.  This bug allowed (effectively) a one-time
volume allocation that would push the "apparant" size over the
oversubscription rate.

Change-Id: I189b689cb76ac2a243aa6e255ce0c80d86e247ce
Fixes: bug/1188877
'}, {'created': '2013-06-08 00:32:58.000000000', 'message': 'Minor Logic bug in NFS Driver.

When checking oversubscription rate, we need to ensure that we
check the _allocated_ (apparant size) not the _available_ (actual
usage) on the NFS share.  This fix ensures we are now checking the
correct values.  This bug allowed (effectively) a one-time
volume allocation that would push the "apparant" size over the

commit_message:
Minor Logic bug in NFS Driver.

When checking oversubscription rate, we need to ensure that we
check the _allocated_ (apparant size) not the _available_ (actual
usage) on the NFS share.  This fix ensures we are now checking the
correct values.  This bug allowed (effectively) a one-time
volume allocation that would push the "apparant" size over the
oversubscription rate.

Change-Id: I189b689cb76ac2a243aa6e255ce0c80d86e247ce
Fixes: bug #1188877

Avoid duplicate pep8 generation

pep8 requirements were always written twice to the
updated requirements. Simply preserve the original pep8
line, like the source code comment mentioned.

Change-Id: I6b23f756594feeea0a5dbe14c58be981501bc5a4

commit_message:
Bump version of PBR.

PBR had an issue building sphinx autodocs, which was fixed between
0.5.11 and 0.5.12. Another issue was quickly spotted and fixed the same
day, so let's bump to 0.5.13.

Change-Id: Ieb0c5f13aa9e7c30b38fbdcd9cb0aa63f339e3da

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-08 06:37:45.000000000', 'message': 'nicira plugin: load subnet once when adding router interface

Bug 1188562

This patch ensure subnet is loaded only once from the database.
Also, the port is now loaded from the database only if the
corresponding NVP logical port is found.

Change-Id: I1626c7b61ddc8e785d8ce2e39619da78b20ae61e
'}]
commit_message:
nicira plugin: load subnet once when adding router interface

Bug 1188562

This patch ensure subnet is loaded only once from the database.
Also, the port is now loaded from the database only if the
corresponding NVP logical port is found.

Change-Id: I1626c7b61ddc8e785d8ce2e39619da78b20ae61e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-08 06:33:55.000000000', 'message': 'Nicira plugin: always fetch lports from correct lswitch

Bug 1188652

Remove get_logical_port_status which required a lswitch uuid, and
replace it with a call to query_lswitch_ports, which does not
require it.

Change-Id: I6c7d0403f37b2c9fb4332a8d34dcaa9050ced3fc
'}]
commit_message:
Nicira plugin: always fetch lports from correct lswitch

Bug 1188652

Remove get_logical_port_status which required a lswitch uuid, and
replace it with a call to query_lswitch_ports, which does not
require it.

Change-Id: I6c7d0403f37b2c9fb4332a8d34dcaa9050ced3fc

commit_message:
Improve test coverage in NEC plugin

blueprint nec-plugin-test-coverage

This commit adds the following changes in unit tests.
- Unit tests to check communications with the controller in NEC plugin
- Unit tests for nec plugin agent
- Improve coverage of OFC drivers
- Mock the client to talk with the external controller in db.

Change-Id: I2b9ab0480da312ea5e804ca04b543cc144b7e545

commit_message:
Integration tests for shares service in Cinder.

A new feature: 'Shares Service' has been proposed to Cinder.
This patch includes the integration tests for the same. As
the service is still not merged in Cinder, it is posted as a WIP
here.

Tempest side of blueprint file-shares-service

Change-Id: I122b3c5ac9aacaab54a4ab705cecf5a78ebf1414

A suggestion inline ...

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-01 16:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I do like the organization of the new diagram, but I'm not sure it's any more "up to date" than the old one. It appears that the only changes in the diagram, aside from moving the boxes around to make it clearer, are adding the "Onsite Agents" box and removing the "Billing & Rating System" and "Compute Agent" boxes.

We still have the compute agent. Are you including that in "onsite agents"? I think it's better to have the individual agents shown, so deployers understand the actual components rather than just the conceptual components.

We should also show the swift middleware that Julien wrote.

And we should have a couple of other diagrams showing how integration with other systems might work, and a diagram of how the pipelines work. I think that level of detail will just clutter up the high-level architecture diagram this is supposed to be, though, so those can come in another changeset.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-05-02 13:20:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The diagram misses the external systems, being billing or other monitoring tools we target with the pipeline publishing.

I'm a little confused to by the green box with an arrow to the API servers, since no OpenStack components actually uses the API. Maybe 2 boxes with OpenStack or non-OpenStack components will be clearer?"}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-05-07 19:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-07 19:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27835/3/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/2276 : SUCCESS in 00:00:48

- http://logs.openstack.org/27835/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/2211 : SUCCESS in 00:02:46
'}, {'account_id': 882, 'date': '2013-05-08 22:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

Thanks Litong, a few comments :)'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-05-09 01:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

shengjin, did you look at the architecture diagram? Please
comment on that diagram.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-05-09 12:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Another thought about this ... the "event listeners" which accept notifications from the openstack components are generally instantiated within the collector service, whereas the diagram kind of implies that these exist as a separate daemon.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 882, 'date': '2013-05-09 12:39:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Do we know who owns the original diagram? that one looks pretty good, just need to be updated IMO :)'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-05-09 12:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Eoghan, do not think any of the boxes imply a daemon. I call
each box a component to avoid being label it to either a
daemon or server. point taken though. My understanding is
that event listeners are event consumers and subscribe to
RabbitMQ and wait for events. In a sense it behaves like a daemon. Any suggestion for improving the chart is welcome.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-05-10 12:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

- Compute agents in OpenStack components?
- Event listeners listening to notifications bus makes no sense. And using the term event bus is really going to be confusing since events are how we're going to call notifications RSN
- I still don't get "with plugin framework", this applies to the agent too… not sure it's worth mentionning
- I still miss the external system we can send meters to.
- central agent without 's' might be better'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-18 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

updates to Ceilometer System Architecture Diagram.

The current diagram is out dated and needs to be updated to reflect
the current design.

Change-Id: Ia29e0a1b220e7bf6e276d4fc18787f5f50db3e32
fixes: bug #1174759

commit_message:
Include a util wraps() decorator that is non-lossy.

The wraps from functools, prior to 3.2 loses the underlying
function which is being wrapped, which is a problem when
introspection is being done on a decorated function. This
brings the functionality from 3.2 (or equiv.) into nova.

Implements: blueprint db-slave-handle

Change-Id: I7dba1e268205d4d72ee32b7ebb0a147b810ac75d

The type='network' setup here is not really useful unless something is actually configuring libvirt virtual networks. What is responsible for this work in OpenStack ? This change doesn't do it, and the blueprint has minimal/near-zero information about how this is expected to work.

commit_message:
Test cleanups for chefspec 1.3.0

ChefSpec 1.3.0 allows tests to evaluate guards.  Wired in
this cookbook to use that functionality.  Made tests a
bit clearer, and better utilize the image_stubs.

Change-Id: I096a0f64d66c0615abda4763f10225cf22bf01be

commit_message:
Remove #memcached_servers from endpoints.rb

Didn't like the fact `#memcached_servers` was inside endpoints.rb.
Also, didn't like db methods inside the default.rb, and how tests
were testing a default recipe, and a default library.  Felt this
should be cleaned up a bit into their own libraries.  This is prep
work to adding a method to return all rabbit servers for the HA
rabbit configuration.

Change-Id: I7d47f09547b04bc57b50a93e6d2f5f70539074c1

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-23 22:22:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think the commit message could be a bit clearer.

Also, I'm not sure how this will affect other hypervisors (seems like it will), so I'd like to have some more eyes on this before I +2."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2013-05-24 02:25:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree, I think more people should take a look and comment on whether this approach is safe.

My rationale is that releasing the ip from a nova standpoint before any attempt is made to destroy the instance at the driver level makes it impossible to prevent the ip from being given out to another instance.

To solve it at a baremetal-only level, I think you would have to do something within the driver to keep trying to turn it off (or disable network) and race against nova giving the ip out again. If and when it succeeds, the ip duplication issue goes away. Or maybe make a call to reserve the ip if power off fails and hope it happens before the ip is given out again (I don't recommend this).

It seems that shutting down the instance can't necessarily be guaranteed and perhaps we should hold onto the ip mapping in nova and not release it if shutdown fails in a way that would result in two instances with the same ip."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-05-30 22:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with Devananda that the commit message could be clearer, but the general idea LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2013-06-06 17:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-06 17:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-23 01:44:37.000000000', 'message': "attempts virt driver destroy before network deallocate

The virt driver destroy can be attempted before  releasing
the instance's ip address so certain destroy failures can
be handled, e.g. if power off fails.

Fixes bug 1180178

Change-Id: I9bde984d2393bd73a73eae6065defb2ed7c01492
"}, {'created': '2013-06-06 17:35:41.000000000', 'message': "Call virt.driver.destroy before deallocating network.

Call virt driver destroy before releasing the instance's
ip address, so that certain failures can be handled.
For instance, if destroy raises InstancePowerOffFailure,
do not deallocate network resources.

Fixes bug 1180178

Change-Id: I9bde984d2393bd73a73eae6065defb2ed7c01492
"}, {'created': '2013-06-07 00:11:09.000000000', 'message': "Call virt.driver.destroy before deallocating network.

Call virt driver destroy before releasing the instance's
ip address, so that certain failures can be handled.
For instance, if destroy raises InstancePowerOffFailure,
do not deallocate network resources.

Fixes bug 1180178

Change-Id: I9bde984d2393bd73a73eae6065defb2ed7c01492
"}]
commit_message:
Call virt.driver.destroy before deallocating network.

Call virt driver destroy before releasing the instance's
ip address, so that certain failures can be handled.
For instance, if destroy raises InstancePowerOffFailure,
do not deallocate network resources.

Fixes bug 1180178

commit_message:
Improve config samples

- Add proxy-logging to multinode. We had it since Folsom and people
  still forget it, resulting in missing logs.
- Use correct name, for ease hit with '*' in vi at least.

Admittedly trivial changes, which I meant to hold until Leah's major
doc improvement lands, but I'm tired of keeping stuff like this in
my working repo.

Change-Id: I44f80c51d6d7329a9b696e67fcb8a895db63e497

'}, {'created': '2013-06-04 21:46:06.000000000', 'message': 'Raise key length defaults

commit_message:
Raise key length defaults

Extend RSA keylength to 2048 bits by default,
as the previous default of 1024 bit is considered
weak since 12/31/2010.

Also unify the message_md to the openssl builtin default.

Fixes bug 1103002

Change-Id: I70e90b7696f8a56073c3d6bdc9ed5d30cfa3401f

commit_message:
Adds support for the Indigo Virtual Switch (IVS)

Implements: blueprint ivs-interface-driver

Adds the IVS VIF type to portbindings.py.
Adds the VIF interface class to allow agents to bind to VIF switches.
Adds support to the BigSwitch plugin to request the IVS VIF type on nova compute nodes.
Adds unit tests for new interface class and changes to BigSwitch plugin.

Change-Id: I2fe104000523c60097c22946b0a80dc404dfe273

[{'created': '2013-06-04 12:15:12.000000000', 'message': 'Moves Nova v3 API enable config to group

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29487/ moves the Nova v3 API
enable flag into its own config group. And renames it to just
"enable". This changeset follows that change. As we do not yet
gate on any Nova V3 API tests we don't need to keep the old setting
around.

Change-Id: If1592cd7b9aad24b6d010870a5fb6bcc60efb8ac
'}]
commit_message:
Moves Nova v3 API enable config to group

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29487/ moves the Nova v3 API
enable flag into its own config group. And renames it to just
"enable". This changeset follows that change. As we do not yet
gate on any Nova V3 API tests we don't need to keep the old setting
around.

Change-Id: If1592cd7b9aad24b6d010870a5fb6bcc60efb8ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-05 19:15:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add the ability to soft_reset a workflow.

In cases where it is not desired to reset the whole state
of the workflow, but only to soft_reset it so that it can
be easily resumed from a interrupted state (for example).
This change allows for that to happen, which involves also
keeping track of the last task that ran so when resumed via
soft_reset that task can be the one started off from (instead
of starting from the start of all tasks).

Change-Id: I034bd6af6445e3da52356328605368319c4ff6f9
'}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to soft_reset a workflow.

In cases where it is not desired to reset the whole state
of the workflow, but only to soft_reset it so that it can
be easily resumed from a interrupted state (for example).
This change allows for that to happen, which involves also
keeping track of the last task that ran so when resumed via
soft_reset that task can be the one started off from (instead
of starting from the start of all tasks).

Change-Id: I034bd6af6445e3da52356328605368319c4ff6f9

commit_message:
Bump openstack-auth version

This was already bumped to 1.0.10 as a prerequisite
for blueprint multiple-service-endpoints, but never merged
to Horizon because the 1.0.10 tarball was broken.

1.0.11 is released which fixes those issues, so require at
least 1.0.11

Change-Id: Ib6b7f239efb35a36d33234ab0824fd3e0debcb25

MySQL constraints are not names like others.

Previous to this patch, we were looking up the names in the
INFORMATION_SCHEMA.REFERENTIAL_CONSTRAINTS table, but were
neglecting to also check the Schema.  The same table
could be in multiple schemas; as an example a unit test
run on the same machine as devstack in two different schemas
but the same RDBMS.

This patch uses a better approach. Sqlalchemy knows about the
name of the constraint, it just doesn't use it in the
drop statement by default.  The Constraint objects from
the main sqlalchemy package don't do drops, only those out
of the migrate package.  This patch finds the name of the
constraint in the constraint bound to the table and passes it
to the migrate ForeignKeyConstraint to use in the drop statement

Bug 1186353

commit_message:
Check schema when dropping constraints.

MySQL constraints are not named like others.

Previous to this patch, we were looking up the names in MySQL's
INFORMATION_SCHEMA.REFERENTIAL_CONSTRAINTS table, but were
neglecting to also check the Schema. The same table
could be in multiple schemas; as an example a unit test
run on the same machine as devstack in two different schemas
but the same RDBMS.

This patch uses a better approach. Sqlalchemy knows about the
name of the constraint, it just doesn't use it in the
drop statement by default. The Constraint objects from
the main sqlalchemy package don't do drops, only those out
of the migrate package. This patch finds the name of the
constraint in the constraint bound to the table and passes it
to the migrate ForeignKeyConstraint to use in the drop statement

Bug 1186353

Change-Id: Ida2184021de9dd220a36507a8a625cf4210d17f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-26 16:31:27.000000000', 'message': "Support for the (WIP) ml2 quantum plugin.

Support is added for configuring devstack to use quantum's Modular L2
plugin, ml2. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20105/ and the
blueprint for details. This version configures the openvswitch L2
agent for use with the ml2 plugin. A future version will add support
for using the linuxbridge agent as well. Code for configurating these
L2 agents has been moved into separate files so it can be shared
between ml2 and the existing monolithic plugins.

To use ml2 in devstack, set Q_PLUGIN=ml2 in localrc. The local, flat,
and vlan network types are supported, but support for gre networks is
not yet implemented in ml2.

Implements: blueprint modular-l2
Change-Id: Ib3ed039d25295cf1ab268536cec408af8cd3795a
"}, {'created': '2013-05-08 02:29:35.000000000', 'message': "Support for the (WIP) ml2 quantum plugin.

"}, {'created': '2013-05-21 23:59:09.000000000', 'message': "Support for the (WIP) ml2 quantum plugin.

Support is added for configuring devstack to use quantum's Modular L2
plugin, ml2. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20105/ and the
blueprint for details. Either the openvswitch or linuxbridge L2 agent
can be used with the ml2 plugin (or both in combination on different
nodes). Code for configurating these L2 agents has been moved into
separate files so it can be shared between ml2 and the existing
monolithic plugins.

To use ml2 in devstack, set Q_PLUGIN=ml2 in localrc. By default it
will use the openvswitch L2 agent. To use ml2 with the linuxbridge
agent, also set Q_AGENT=linuxbridge in localrc. The local, flat, and
vlan network types are supported with either agent, but support for
openvswitch's gre network type is not yet implemented in ml2.

Note that ml2 does not yet return a useful value for binding:vif_type,
so nova's GenricVIFDriver cannot currently be used. If using the
linuxbridge agent, work around this by setting
NOVA_VIF_DRIVER=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LinuxBridgeVIFDriver in localrc.

Implements: blueprint modular-l2
Change-Id: Ib3ed039d25295cf1ab268536cec408af8cd3795a
"}, {'created': '2013-05-27 20:22:18.000000000', 'message': "Support for the ml2 quantum plugin.

To use ml2 in devstack, set Q_PLUGIN=ml2 in localrc. By default it

vlan network types are supported with either agent. Support for
openvswitch's gre network type is not yet implemented in ml2.

Note that ml2 does not yet return a useful value for binding:vif_type,
so nova's GenricVIFDriver cannot currently be used. If using the
linuxbridge agent, work around this by setting
NOVA_VIF_DRIVER=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LinuxBridgeVIFDriver in localrc.

Implements: blueprint modular-l2
Change-Id: Ib3ed039d25295cf1ab268536cec408af8cd3795a
"}]
commit_message:
Support for the ml2 quantum plugin.

Support is added for configuring devstack to use quantum's Modular L2
plugin, ml2. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20105/ and the
blueprint for details. Either the openvswitch or linuxbridge L2 agent
can be used with the ml2 plugin (or both in combination on different
nodes). Code configurating devstack for these L2 agents has been moved
into separate files so it can be shared between ml2 and the existing
monolithic plugins.

To use ml2 in devstack, set Q_PLUGIN=ml2 in localrc. By default it
will use the openvswitch L2 agent. To use ml2 with the linuxbridge
agent, also set Q_AGENT=linuxbridge in localrc. The local, flat, and
vlan network types are supported with either agent. Support for
openvswitch's gre network type is not yet implemented in ml2.

Note that ml2 does not yet return a useful value for binding:vif_type,
so nova's GenricVIFDriver cannot currently be used. If using the
linuxbridge agent, work around this by setting
NOVA_VIF_DRIVER=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LinuxBridgeVIFDriver in localrc.

Implements: blueprint modular-l2
Change-Id: Ib3ed039d25295cf1ab268536cec408af8cd3795a

Two new parameters could be added to the Horizon's local_settings.py:
SAVANNA_SERVICE - the UI searches in keystone for service having that name. Set to 'mapreduce' by default.
SAVANNA_URL - if present, UI accesses Savanna by that URL, ignoring SAVANNA_SERVICE.

Change-Id: I8a7808a05a707259f67f43370bcfba40a0609663
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance Savanna discovery logic

Two new parameters could be added to the Horizon's local_settings.py:
SAVANNA_SERVICE - the UI searches in keystone for service having that name. Set to 'mapreduce' by default.
SAVANNA_URL - if present, UI accesses Savanna by that URL, ignoring SAVANNA_SERVICE.

Change-Id: I8a7808a05a707259f67f43370bcfba40a0609663

(1 inline comment)

I think you might be missing one more constraint?

Otherwise, looks like solid work."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-06-05 14:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Overall this is great work.

However, I have a general concern about using '$' in constraint names, not because it causes a problem in mysql/postgres/sqlite (afaik, it doesn't) but because of client tools in various langugages which may interpret '$' characters when identifiers are not properly quoted. I would prefer to stick with non-special characters in all identifiers.

FWIW, I agree that there is a need to distinguish the table from column names within the unique constraint's identifier, so, here is another suggestion: "uniq_t_x_c1_c2_c3" where "x" is a literal character and t, c1, c2, c3 are table and column identifiers. I'm not partial to this - anything else which moves away from using "$" or other potentially-reserved characters is fine.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-06 05:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

"uniq_t_x_c1_c2_c3" - this won't work at all because we have a tons of fields that are using _ in their names: 
instance_uuid, project_id, report_count. 

And I know only one symbol $ that works fine with different backends and our sqlalchemy. 

Also we have to switch to "smaller" size (using 1 symbol instead on _x_)  name convention, because we have a limits on mysql to maximun name length, and we are not able to create UC on some tables (if we are using 3symb delimeter)

Probalby the only one way is 2symb name convention __ (but it could produce problems in some cases)'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-06-06 08:13:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

Boris +1

Brian, I guess that it's a unique index rather than a UC"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-06 08:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-06-06 08:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-06-06 15:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-06-06 19:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Identifier length limitation should be discussed independently from what separator ("$" or "__" or other) is used in the identifiers. Even with a one-character separator, it is possible for an automatically generated name based on table and column names to be too long, and so a solution for that must exist regardless.

It would be trivial to have a function iterate over the column names and trim trailing characters, until the total length is underneath MySQL's limit.


Regarding "$" vs "__" or something else, I understand that "$" is allowed by sqlalchemy and our RDBMS back ends within a delimited identifier. My concern is about other tools which will attempt to interact with the resulting schema and fail in unexpected ways. For example (and I haven't tried this, but) I imagine that it might be more challenging to create a bash script which pulls index stats from INFORMATION_SCHEMA if the identifier names contain "$". 

Perhaps this is an unfounded concern; maybe I'm the only one who does things like this in bash instead of python, or maybe I'm just lazy and don't want to think about adding escape chars to identifier names :)'}, {'account_id': 7491, 'date': '2013-06-07 15:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-07 15:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-07 16:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

Build succeeded.

[{'created': '2013-05-22 13:26:29.000000000', 'message': 'Rename unique constraints due to new convention.

We found that current constraint name convention allows us create
constraints with duplicate names. It happens if we will add constraints
in different tables with same column names (for example, `name`,
`deleted`). In this case we can not create new constraint in mysql due to
database limitation (it requires unique constraint name for database)
To solve this issue unique constraint name convention was changed
from "uniq_c1_x_c2_x_c3" to "uniq_t$c1$c2$c3" where `t` it is table name
and columns `c1`, `c2`, `c3` are in UniqueConstraint.
Fixed unique constraints in models description.

commit_message:
Rename unique constraints due to new convention.

We have found that current constraint name convention allows us to create
constraints with duplicate names. It happens if we add constraints
in different tables with the same column names (for example, `name`,
`deleted`). In this case we can not create new constraint in mysql due to
database limitation (it requires constraint name to be unique within a
database). To solve this issue unique constraint name convention has
been changed from "uniq_c1_x_c2_x_c3" to "uniq_t0c10c20c3" where `t` is
a table name and columns `c1`, `c2`, `c3` are in UniqueConstraint.
Fixed unique constraints in models description.
Synced db code from oslo (function `_raise_if_duplicate_entry_error()`
modified respectively to new unique constraint name convention).

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys
Fixes: bug 1182054

Change-Id: I4122dfb910a07a1a423781ebc22e9ce50596a05d

commit_message:
Re-enabled the delete_queue tests in the integration tests

We now clean up rpc queues upon guest agent deletion, so we can re-enable
the integration test that tests this.

Fixes bug 1182270

Change-Id: Ib4384676d2758cc5842bdd9d2ffd5f5a75e45acc

Prepare repository for a Puppet Forge release

  Commit updates README.md with a more complete set of documentation,
  removes travis.yml since we're on stackfoge now, and updates the
  Modulefile for the new release.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30156/2/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-unit-3.0/118 : SUCCESS in 1m 11s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30156/2/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-unit-3.1/117 : SUCCESS in 1m 12s
'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-05-23 04:06:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

I don't feel comfortable with that kind of fix. It manages resources outside the scope of nova which could result in resource conflicts.

The only puppet module I know that's managing dnsmasq-utils is puppet-quantum. But I don't see why you would use both at the same time.

I would like additional feedback from someone else on this one."}, {'account_id': 7208, 'date': '2013-05-23 05:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

nova-network (i.e., not quantum) uses dhcp_release if you set "force_dhcp_release" to true, which this module does. One RHEL systems, this program is not available unless you install dnsmasq-utils. At the very least, this causes the logs to fill up with spam about commands that are unable to run; also, I imagine (but have not tested) that if it's not installed, dnsmasq is not forced to update its leases table when an instance is terminated, which is the intent of that flag.

I understand if this doesn't seem like an appropriate place to put it, but if it's not in the upstream module I'll just have to put it in my local manifests to resolve this issue.'}, {'account_id': 7208, 'date': '2013-05-23 05:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Actually, it looks like the official guidance is to disable that flag in RHEL <= 6.2, and install dnsmasq-utils in >= 6.3: http://docs.openstack.org/essex/openstack-compute/install/yum/content/config-requirements-rhel.html

Shall I implement these recommendations in the module?'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-05-23 22:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we can add it there until we figure out a better way to handle this situation.'}, {'account_id': 7537, 'date': '2013-06-04 14:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-06-05 17:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-05 17:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Install dnsmasq-utils on RedHat platforms

If $force_dhcp_release is true in nova.conf, nova tries to use the
tool "/usr/bin/dhcp_release", which isn't available without this
package. This ensures the package is present on RHEL-type systems.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/970893

Change-Id: I5470641410b4640e69ede19609e1f262e8cd0d3f

commit_message:
Remove <cond> and <val1> or <val2> systax

Use <val1> if <cond> else <val2> instead.
There're more talks:
[0] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/394809/ternary-conditional-operator-in-python
[1] http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0308/

Fixes bug 1188111

Change-Id: I485e674317faf319a26ab30c2c193d8464a7e46e

commit_message:
Fixed race condition in the Restore workflow

When an instance is restored from a backup, during the step when the root
password is being reset, we now check to ensure that the mysqld daemon is
up, before we kill the process. This ensures that the root password is
always reset successfully.

Fixes bug 1187958

Change-Id: If5a5c0293c0dc51c3f118abbcc52c3fb0d1d3cfa

Also add dependency on json <= 1.7.7, required by Chef 11.

Resolves problem: Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem

Partial fix for bug #1183540

Change-Id: I5bf4e008100827bfefd56b142b1ea8d3a027806f
'}]
commit_message:
Update Chef dependency to Chef 11

Also add dependency on json <= 1.7.7, required by Chef 11.

Resolves problem: Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem
"json" (required for chef and berkshelf).

Partial fix for bug #1183540

Change-Id: I5bf4e008100827bfefd56b142b1ea8d3a027806f

commit_message:
Default to m1.micro for heat test flavor.

This is big enough for the current tests, and it may be worth the effort
to optimise more complex tests to fit in a m1.micro for as long as practical.

Change-Id: Id6e43b0b172c996e5091bf2cf7fd245ccfc87d4c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-07 14:50:10.000000000', 'message': 'Changed processing unique constraint name.

Mr. Devananda found that dollar sign can be used as special symbol in
various programming langugages and proposed to use `0` instead of `$`.
So unique constraint name convention was changed from "uniq_t$c1$c2$c3"
to "uniq_t0c10c20c3" where `0` it is delimiter, `t` it is table name and
columns `c1`, `c2`, `c3` are in UniqueConstraint.

Function `_raise_if_duplicate_entry_error()` modified respectively to
new unique constraint name convention.

Change-Id: I88208dc03b55bbbc709b18580048c008004c9fda
'}]
commit_message:
Changed processing unique constraint name.

Mr. Devananda found that dollar sign can be used as special symbol in
various programming langugages and proposed to use `0` instead of `$`.
So unique constraint name convention was changed from "uniq_t$c1$c2$c3"
to "uniq_t0c10c20c3" where `0` it is delimiter, `t` it is table name and
columns `c1`, `c2`, `c3` are in UniqueConstraint.

Function `_raise_if_duplicate_entry_error()` modified respectively to
new unique constraint name convention.

Change-Id: I88208dc03b55bbbc709b18580048c008004c9fda

except x as y: construct, which works with any
Python version >= 2.6, including Python 3.x.

I request nova-core to please review the patch since it is due to be merged for Grizzly-3 milestone.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-01-31 16:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just starting to review this but a few questions/comments right off the bat:

a) Can you put an example usage of nova live-migration? I'm not exactly sure what you would pass in --block-device-mapping.

b) A high level description of what is happening during the block migrate would be great. There is nothing in the blueprint describing what is happening.

c) Is the volume data copied by nova or cinder?

d) Is there a reason this should be done during block migration? It seems like it would make sense to do the volume migration separately."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-01-31 16:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

one more point. If you are adding data to the live migration action, this needs a new api extension. This is another reason it might be preferrable to do it with a separate command.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-31 17:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

This is pretty large and seems to cover a lot of stuff all in one patch. Can you break this up into smaller pieces so that feeble minded folks like myself can digest it a little better? I saw several things that looked like they might be able to be done separately, and stopped reviewing when I got to the volume_size one.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-01-31 17:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2013-02-01 13:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2013-02-01 13:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (11 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2013-02-01 14:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Let me know if all your queries are addressed by the info provided on them.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/migrate-volume-block-migration

http://wiki.openstack.org/migrate-volume-block-migration'}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2013-02-01 14:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Please ignore the links garbling above.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-01 14:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20333/4/check/gate-nova-docs/13816 : SUCCESS
