commit_message:
Rename functions which should not be run as tests.

These function names confuse some test runners which results in them
incorrectly being run as tests.

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6495, 'name': 'Senhua Huang', 'email': 'senhua.huang@gmail.com', 'username': 'senhuang'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6495, 'date': '2013-05-10 00:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-10 00:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-05-10 01:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-10 01:49:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

There's all sorts of problems with this.

1) We cannot just remove options.  They should be deprecated first.
2) Cells has an 'enable' option within the 'cells' config group.
3) Cells being enabled or not does not determine the class to use alone.  When cells are enabled, the CellsAPI class is used in the API cell, and the normal API class is used in child cells.

I disagree with this bug and patch in general (at least for the moment)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-10 01:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/25640 : SUCCESS in 00:03:13
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-nova-docs/19858/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 00:02:56
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-nova-python26/21266 : SUCCESS in 00:17:35
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-nova-python27/21354 : SUCCESS in 00:08:38
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/15346 : SUCCESS in 00:46:40
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/15062 : FAILURE in 00:47:12 (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/21629 : SUCCESS in 00:22:21
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/3077 : FAILURE in 00:11:14 (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/28750/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/11325 : SUCCESS in 00:09:27 (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-10 21:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There's a couple ways we could go with this:

1) Add another cells option that is cell_type=api or cell_type=compute, and choose the right class based on that.

2) If #1 is unacceptable for some reason, we could compromise by using Python entrypoints, which we're migrating over to using elsewhere.  They can include support for "short name" aliases.  That way we don't have Python paths/class names in the configuration, but it's still pluggable if you insist and know what you're doing (and accept that it's not necessarily a stable interface).

Here is a similar patch in progress:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28267/'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-10 21:09:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd be fine with either one of those.  If you want to get rid of the plug-ability, I'm fine with #1.  But introducing another 'cells enable' type option (as is the case with the current patch set) is completely confusing.

Ideally we ditch the need for the special class in the API cell for cells... but that's a ways out yet."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-05-10 22:13:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Cool, I'm all for removing plugging completely where we feel it's acceptable, so let's go with #1.

I'm setting -2 on this because I want to make sure I can review this before it goes in.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6495, 'date': '2013-05-10 22:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For the 1st approach, should the patch look like this:
api_class = computeAPI
if cell.enable && cell_type == cell.api
   api_class = cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI
return api_class?

I will remove the enable_cell option.'}, {'account_id': 6495, 'date': '2013-05-11 02:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-11 02:52:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

'}, {'account_id': 6495, 'date': '2013-05-20 02:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Use the existing of "cells.cell_type" as an indicator of legacy cell configuration and new style configuration. For the legacy cell configuration, "cells.cell_type" will have a default value of "", the added function will then use compute.api.class option to decide which ComputeAPI to use. For the new style configuration, the added function will use "cells.cell_type" and "cells.enable" together to decide which ComputeAPI to use. Please review it and see whether it is appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-21 09:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (3 inline comments)

that returns nova.compute.cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI if cell is
enabled, and returns compute.api.API otherwise.
Add an option "enable_cell" to the config.

commit_message:
Deprecate compute_api_class option in the config

Add a function "get_compute_api_class_name" within nova.compute
that returns nova.compute.cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI if cell is
enabled and this cell is an API cell, and returns compute.api.API
otherwise.
Add an option "cell_type" to the config in group "cells".
Use the default value of "cell_type" (None) for legacy configuration.

Change-Id: I32f5ccf789c657b563c165bfa8244e819b1a79a6
Fixes: bug #1049249

[{'created': '2013-06-04 15:01:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance creation when a network with no subnet is used

It is possible with OpenStack Networking to create a network with no
subnet attached to it.
When creating an instance associated to such a network, the engine would
raise a 'list index out of range' exception because the instance has no
IP address on the network.
The issue would also happen with a loadbalancer referencing the same
type of instance.

Change-Id: I6122efb90877d8020added44aee8802eb8a80297
Fixes: bug #1187023
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance creation when a network with no subnet is used

It is possible with OpenStack Networking to create a network with no
subnet attached to it.
When creating an instance associated to such a network, the engine would
raise a 'list index out of range' exception because the instance has no
IP address on the network.
The issue would also happen with a loadbalancer referencing the same
type of instance.

Change-Id: I6122efb90877d8020added44aee8802eb8a80297
Fixes: bug #1187023

I disagree with you because while working on fixing code style anyone can add new code that will not pass style checks and such verbosity provides an ability to fix style checks disabling them and fixing one by one. commit_message:
Make ManagerWithFind abstract and fix its descendants

ManagerWithFind requires list() method in its descendants.
Make it abstract and fix its improper descendants that do
not implement list() (QuotaSetManager and others).

Change-Id: I691ca389b5fea4c1bb36499a264b578fa825bbbf
Fixes: bug #1180393

(1 inline comment)

On tiny thing inline.

Also, there aren't any tests anywhere ensuring that  'safe_decode' or 'ensure_str' is being called where it should be. Ideally we would have tests ensuring this change didn't change any behavior."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-30 18:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-05-30 19:07:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This requires a prequel patch with tests, to ensure these changes dont break anything."}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-31 15:20:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

Hey Flavio, that test that you sent me that was added in one commit: https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/8c70c5b08d6ecae90c2df1ee5c7ba995e3329926/tests/v1/test_images.py#L314

That doesn't even test what was added in that commit. if you undo everything but the test changes it still passes.

I'm not sure how much of a stickler we should be about code changes that don't have test coverage. One the one hand, it's a lot more work to have to do just because past developers didn't add tests when they wrote the code. On the other, if we are always strict then the tests will always be there.

I am just going to say that I don't know if I care enough to hold up this patch. Glance-core needs to establish a philosophy about this that is different from what I've seen done in the past (making a bug for missing tests for code that isn't even merged yet).

Sorry for taking up so much time on a simple refactor patch. I'll defer to other core members.

/rant"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-31 16:11:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That test was about verifying headers were unicode, I wouldn't be surprised it passes depending on the environment.

I think we should *always* require tests for patches that actually need one, which means all of them. My point about this one is that it pulls in strutils and doesn't add any new functionality. While strutils is already tested in oslo, I'd agree that other methods might need further testing here but, is it the right patch to do it?

Thinking about this a bit more, I'd say no and this is why:

Something that every reviewer should keep in mind is that patches might need to be reverted for unexpected reasons and so need to be the patches related to the patch being reverted. If we add tests for this patch in a separate patch then, in an eventual revert, we'd revert this one and still keep the tests which would / should work anyway since the encoding support was already there.

What Iccha suggested makes sense, create a patch that this patch will depend on and which will contain tests for the methods requiring them. 

The client needs some care and that's something we, glance people, should always keep in mind and enforce contributors to keep consistency, coverage not just in the server side but in the client as well.

Conclusion: I'll create a new patch with some tests :)"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-31 17:55:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sweet sounds good. Exactly what I want...how would we have tests before this patch if they were in it ;)'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-06-03 14:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-03 15:43:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Replace utils.ensure_(str|unicode) with strutils.safe(decode|encode)

Glanceclient implemented both functions before they landed into oslo.
Since both functions are already in oslo, it is now possible to pull
them in.

There's a small difference between glance's implementation and oslo's,
that is the later does not convert non-str objects - int, bool - to str
before trying to decode / encode them. This patch takes care of that
where necessary, more precisely, while encoding headers before doing a
new request.

Fixes bug: #1172253

Change-Id: I9a0dca31140bae28d8ec6aede515c5bb852b701b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-30 22:09:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix config registration in cinder volume drivers.

Slowly moving away from FLAGS to Conf, we had a mix still
of registration between flags and Conf.

This patch fixes the drivers so that if they have Conf options
they're registered prior to init, and also if they were still using
Flags or a mix of Conf and Flags, they're converted to using just Conf.

Note there are two drivers that were not updated due to breaking unit tests:
  1. windows.py
  2. zadara.py

The zadara folks have indicated that they're in the process of updating and
releasing a new version of their driver so I left that as is.

I'll need to raise a separate issue for the windows driver and come back to
it at a later time.

Fixes bug: 1179159

Change-Id: I90165299bf080da17741d027e36e361540da0ff8
"}, {'created': '2013-05-30 22:43:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix config registration in cinder volume drivers.

"}, {'created': '2013-05-31 00:52:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix config registration in cinder volume drivers.

Slowly moving away from FLAGS to Conf, we had a mix still
of registration between flags and Conf.

Even though we use "self.configuration" on __init__ we still
can provide the CONF settings for introspection, there might be a
better way of doing this than what I have here (creating two config objects,
one that's not actually used).

The main thing however is to get away from FLAGS and switch over to CONF for
the drivers in Cinder.  Also adds the missing __init__ to the scality driver.

The self.configuration.append... method is needed to allow multiple back-ends
of the same type to have their own independent settings.  This patch doesn't
fix that on all drivers due to a number of issues with tests and how the
drivers are written, however it does at least get all of the drivers away from
using FLAGS and using CONF.

Note there are two drivers that were not updated at all here:
  1. windows.py
  2. zadara.py

The zadara folks have indicated that they're in the process of updating and
releasing a new version of their driver so I left that as is.

The windows driver needs a bit of work to switch over.

Fixes bug: 1179159

Change-Id: I90165299bf080da17741d027e36e361540da0ff8

commit_message:
Fix config registration in cinder volume drivers.

The config documentation relies on options being registered
on a modules import.  Our need to move the drivers to using
self.configuration for multi-backend support means that options
wouldn't be loaded until object initialization which breaks
documentation.

This patch puts a dummy CONF init/load back in the drivers. While putting
this change together I came across a number of drivers still using FLAGS,
and even worse a number of drivers using a mixture of FLAGS and CONF and
self.configuraiton.  So most of those are cleaned up here as well.

Note there are two drivers that were not updated at all here:
  1. windows.py
  2. zadara.py

The zadara folks have indicated that they're in the process of updating and
releasing a new version of their driver so I left that as is.

The windows driver needs a bit of work to switch over.

Fixes bug: 1179159

Change-Id: I90165299bf080da17741d027e36e361540da0ff8

[{'created': '2013-06-04 20:27:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove duplicate appends to image list.

The BaseImageTest class method create_image() already adds created
images to the list of created images. Created images don't need to be
manually appended to the class image tracking list created_images. This
removes all the duplicate appends for tests that use the base class
create_image().

Change-Id: Id99e7ed9a88e513172b1962993dd21bd5feea02f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate appends to image list.

The BaseImageTest class method create_image() already adds created
images to the list of created images. Created images don't need to be
manually appended to the class image tracking list created_images. This
removes all the duplicate appends for tests that use the base class
create_image().

Change-Id: Id99e7ed9a88e513172b1962993dd21bd5feea02f

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-18 16:19:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

In this case it better if you do not catch the exception at all, let it fail.

* The log will contain the previous steps.
* The exception itself will contain the exact location
* The exception will tell you more details what was wrong

The human readable messages are not really useful for debugging.

If the test once fails on the gate, you just see what is in the log. It should contain as much information about the original exception context as possible.

If you have multiple instructions in a try block and you throw another exception in the except block you will lose the original exception.

Generally we should not have any try block in a test case."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-19 20:20:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

If the id is the missing part the 
probably self.assertIn('id', dir(self.keypair))
can be used instead of the try block.

Look like similar exception handling is exist in the code, it should be fixed too, in this or in another change which fixes similar type of issues."}, {'account_id': 6719, 'date': '2013-05-20 13:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6719, 'date': '2013-05-21 15:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-21 16:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for configuring ssl token_format

this commit adds support for the ssl token format for keystone.

This is currently the default configuration for openstack grizzly,
but not the current default for the Puppet modules.

Change-Id: I608afe688146e68c8f89042650e0035a0230ff2f

Small inline question, don't see any other problems"}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-05-13 18:36:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The code looks fine for iscsi, but I think another level of abstraction is needed to support backends that can't/don't want to attach the volume locally just to do I/O, like rbd and sheepdog.

Instead of having local attach/detach methods for all volumes, we could have a more general open/read/write/close api for drivers. For iscsi, open and close could be implemented by local attach/detach. rbd/sheepdog could implement these methods using their own libraries/commands.

This would allow general backup or other tasks that require I/O (like copying a volume) to be implemented at the manager level much more easily, and work across all backends."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-05-14 05:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-05-14 07:47:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add the local-versioned open/close, read/write & backup/restore.

Open/Close: For iSCSi drivers, it is open/close is implemented by attach/detach,
while for non-iSCSI drivers, it could be implemented by their own libraries.

Read/write: For iSCSI drivers, it is done by the "dd" command. For other
drivers, there left a choice for them to implement the methods "read_volume"
and "write_volume".

Backup to/Restore from the volume: On the same host, the content of a snapshot
can be copied into a volume for backup and restore from this backup.

This patch can be used for block-to-block backup, volume migration, etc.

Partially implementing the blueprint block-level-backup.

Change-Id: I783262dfb62ff22a1f2a6ef0a578554a4dd68cb7

subject: Add extra start points on grenade.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-22 13:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30101/1/check/gate-noop/1785 : SUCCESS in 0s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30101/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/5212 : FAILURE in 11m 04s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-05-22 21:04:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It would help me to know the use case for this.  For example, why does -c run both the 'cache' and 'javelin' sections?  Do you not want to also run the 'cache' section by itself?

You can get the same result from the 'javelin' section by just running setup-javelin, save-state and stop-base manually.  That's one of the reasons most of the work is done in sub-scripts.  Would moving the 'cache' section to another script be helpful?"}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-05-22 21:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The idea is to run the base parts separate from the target, that's why -c would run up to 'stop_base' and -j the javelin and stop_base pieces. 
I agree that another possibility is to move the cache_images to a separate script.
Even though, if we get stuck on some error in the base stack.sh, it would require to run each script separately: exercise.sh, cache_image, setup_javelin and stop_base, before running 'grenade.sh -t'.
Thus, a start point after the base stack.sh might be useful. 
Finally, the whole idea here is to get an easy/quick fix to help debug, but I agree we can work on a better, proper solution."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-06 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-06 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add extra start points on grenade.sh

This will make it possible to run grenade in even more parts
as just cache the images (in case stack.sh fails), or just
run the javelin part, if something before breaks

Fix: Bug 1182872

Change-Id: I1957ff0a17c1d087f3a5c95bf97609e2b6e534c3

The bp didn't approve yet. Hope sending some code good for discussion and review the BP."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-31 01:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Alex, how about you start a ML discussion?'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-05-31 02:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We added a heartbeat API to the matchmaker in Grizzly as part of "advanced-matchmaking". This change builds on that.

It seems what you want to do is add a mmap-based matchmaker?'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-05-31 02:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zhongyue, thanks, I will send notes on ML.

Eric, I want to make the heartbeat can be used by quantum agent. Currently quantum agent use db based heartbeat, that is inefficient. So I am looking for a solution. There are two solution in nova service group api and matchmaker. What I understand of matchmaker is that only used by zmq. So I am try to merge the heartbeat implement of service group api and matchmaker, and hope it can be used by both agent heartbeat and matchmaker. Thanks, Alex.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-05-31 05:06:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (8 inline comments)

I just quickly ran through the code and left some questions. I'll take a closer look on your next patch. Thanks"}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-06-03 06:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (8 inline comments)

Zhongyue, thanks for your review!'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-06-06 05:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-05-16 21:48:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

SO - the reason you're hitting the H402 error on config is that to determine whether or not the thing being imported we have to import the thing. In this case, config cannot be imported because it's full of side effects that happen on import which is an evil thing and should die.

We're working on making hacking clearer in this case - but your config module should not run that code when you import it. Instead, you should really have that stuff encapsulated in a method, and that method should return an object that lets you get at the information or something."}, {'account_id': 6971, 'date': '2013-05-17 14:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-17 14:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add System Tests

This patch adds the System level testing framework &
the initial set of tests for Marconi.This will allow
developers to run the system tests (regression suite for
Marconi system level tests), against local Marconi server.

Refer tests/system/README.rst file for details on
how to add new tests and run the existing tests.

Change-Id: I2f47e03091acc260293b19edad69ff5c83888ec3
Implements: blueprint system-tests

commit_message:
Only call FnGetAtt if resource is in acceptable state.

This will give resource type authors some certainty on what error
checking their FnGetAtt methods will require.

Fixes bug: #1184794

Change-Id: Iec456075c14cd609cf9607f07bce23e4c6b33c0c

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30835/2/check/gate-heat-pep8/3291 : SUCCESS in 2m 12s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30835/2/check/gate-heat-python26/3246 : SUCCESS in 2m 37s

- http://logs.openstack.org/30835/2/check/dev-heat-coverage/1614 : FAILURE in 20s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-31 23:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am concerned that this might break a common usage pattern that I have in Heat.

I often pass in Fn::GetAtt: [ thisresource, PrivateIp ] in Metadata of a resource. It results in 0.0.0.0 the first boot, but then I do an update stack, which fills in the IP. This is often simpler and more reliable than trying to figure out what IP is "mine" from inside the instance.

I haven't given this much thought, so its possible this will not break my use case, but I wanted to voice my concerns.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-06-03 02:07:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Clint: wouldn't it be better getting that info from nova's metadata? http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/metadata-service.html (ec2)

 curl http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/meta-data/local-ipv4"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-06-05 08:40:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

OK, I swear I posted comments on this yesterday, but I was having network issues and apparently they went to /dev/null.

For the Public IP the correct way to do this is to use an EIP resource and link it to the instance with an EIPAssociation, thus avoiding the dependency loop, but there doesn't seem to be an equivalent for the private IP. Getting it from the metadata server/config drive definitely sounds preferable to using Fn::GetAtt.

It would be simple to add a change that prevented any resource from creating a dependency on itself, but I'm reluctant to do that because it might create the impression among users that this actually works, when in fact it doesn't (you have to do an update before it picks up the value)."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-05 23:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 23:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30835/3/check/gate-heat-pep8/3352 : SUCCESS in 1m 33s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30835/3/check/gate-heat-python26/3307 : SUCCESS in 2m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30835/3/check/gate-heat-python27/3306 : SUCCESS in 1m 48s
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-06-05 23:09:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok I'm convinced. Will strat re-working refstack/tripleo templates to work differently."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-06-05 23:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 23:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Make Fn::GetAtt add a dependency

This will ensure that resources which get attributes from other resources
are not created until the latter resources are available.

An audit of all the templates in the heat-templates repo revealed that in
only one case did this cause a circular reference, and it was the template
that appeared to be incorrect (it has since been fixed).

Change-Id: Ibd51acdda55c24f665c5ca887040f3564d952c0e

[{'created': '2013-06-06 00:15:03.000000000', 'message': "standard_filters is deprecated

When using standard_fitlers, a warning is thrown:

WARNING log.deprecated Deprecated: Use 'nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters'
instead of 'nova.scheduler.filters.standard_filters'

This is consistent with the docs for scheduler
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/scheduler-filters.html

Change-Id: I8eee806f8b4100b2ccb6ad054e8a10722aefa5ef
"}]
commit_message:
standard_filters is deprecated

When using standard_fitlers, a warning is thrown:

WARNING log.deprecated Deprecated: Use 'nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters'
instead of 'nova.scheduler.filters.standard_filters'

This is consistent with the docs for scheduler
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/scheduler-filters.html

Change-Id: I8eee806f8b4100b2ccb6ad054e8a10722aefa5ef

commit_message:
Disable H102 until ready to add new checks

We need to release a bug fix release, 0.5.5, which cannot contain any
new checks.  Currently there are several open bugs, and more testing
that is needed before we are ready to start adding new checks.

Since we are pinning hacking versions to <0.6, we can releases,
every time we add new checks we need to rev the minor release number.
But since we don't have extensive enough testing in this repository I
am not confident in our ability to add new working checks.

So until we are ready to cut 0.6 disable the check.

Change-Id: I84582fb41d859166395ba150c10e5a859a528950

commit_message:
Add db_version command to keystone-manage

The db_version command simply looks at the database and prints the
version to which the database has been migrated.

Change-Id: I50098bf1aa6d57883cc9acc0c4d09d9c8448db7f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-06 00:31:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed test scripts to use binaries from usr_bin_dir instead of code_root_dirs

Nova has moved to using entry points for nova binaries.
These are now located at /usr/local/bin/* instead of /nova_code_root/bin/*
Fixed the config file to contain a new entry for usr_bin_dir, from where it
should pick up these binaries. (default is /usr/local/bin)

Fixes bug 1187965

Change-Id: Ia0296e6d2d2d3eebb6cf46e958fe280c8fbfe42a
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed test scripts to use binaries from usr_bin_dir instead of code_root_dirs

Nova has moved to using entry points for nova binaries.
These are now located at /usr/local/bin/* instead of /nova_code_root/bin/*
Fixed the config file to contain a new entry for usr_bin_dir, from where it
should pick up these binaries. (default is /usr/local/bin)

Fixes bug 1187965

Change-Id: Ia0296e6d2d2d3eebb6cf46e958fe280c8fbfe42a

More detailed log in failing aggregate extra filter.

For easier debuging. Report more detailed log when
aggregate_instance_extra_specs failed.

Moving `test_misc` tests to better locations

We now have more specific places to put the tests contained within
`test_misc`.

commit_message:
Do not decode headers in v1/images.py

v1.images._image_meta_to_headers currently encodes headers as a way to
ensure they're an instance of basestring. This is not necessary since
headers will be encoded later during the request. Also, all data within
the client should be already decoded.

Fixes bug: #1187013

Change-Id: I80525adbc6e9e576cfad5b576090ef9ee574c1cf

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-04-11 17:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

In general, I think you should be clear that you can only get the capacity information for neighboring cells.

I believe that if the "tree" of configured cells is more than 2 layers deep, the neighbor/child cells will return an aggregate value of the free capacity of all the child cells lower in the tree.

If you would like to support the general case of a N-depth cell tree, then you need to implement code to do the "message running" down to the correct cell and get its information.'}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-04-15 05:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

Please find replies to comments.

We looked at the cell show call which does a db.cell_get.
So we assumed that every cell will have info about all cells below that, regardless of the depth.

But looks like it only has information about it's neighboring cells. We don't exactly know how to route the message to the intended cell. Would a "_TargetedMessage" with the "cell_name" take care of routing?'}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-04-15 06:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-15 07:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-05-27 14:13:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

First we need to put that into a new extension, otherwise clients will ask for this kind of information in a system which doesn't have it (and also the reverse, which is less critical).

You could create an extension (extended_cells) that just create a show method which extends the original in cells extension and show capacities (only if this new extension is loaded, avoiding breaking stuff).

also I think (and I *only* think cause I don't have in mind the full scope of cells) that you should define a policy to that new show since you can get all cells capacities (meaning that you probably can access some cell that you're not supposed to).

Some other comments inline."}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-05-27 17:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-05-27 17:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (7 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6992, 'date': '2013-05-29 15:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

Please find the answers for your comments


"ok you're right, it's an extension.. I didn't realized that cause the method in the api continues on cells...that make things hard to keep in order, maybe even to maintain someday..."

First of all i'm not completely convinced that it has to be a separate extension. However I've added one for discoverability.
To give you some more context, the capacity info was supposed to be a part of show and index of cells.
However we are adding a new api for capacities so that older clients' show/ index would not be broken.

The plan is to merge this into show and index as soon as v3 is out. So it's not going to be a maintenance problem.


"what about create a controller on your extension, with a show and index that would use show for show an specified cell capacity and use index to show all cells capacities?
and what about use a new entry point and do operations like: GET /<project_id>/os-cells-capacities to get all cells capacities, and GET /<project_id>/os-cells-capacities/<cell_id> to get a specific cell capacity instead of GET on /os-cells"

We could add a separate extension all together. But it doesn't make sense to have it without the cells extension. So it's dependent on it. And it belongs to the same resource os-cells.
We can't add separate extensions for every change/ addition to an extension.
 

"Put things of one extension inside the other looks bad to me.."

Yes it does, The whole extensions thingy looks bad to me. But this is how it's done currently. 
Refer to - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29924/3/nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quotas.py,
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py#L235

So till we merge this into v3 os-cells, I think we can go with this approach.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-05-30 10:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

I think this seems like a pragmatic way to add things into v2.

I guess you could extend what is returned from the existing detail/show methods, but that is less friendly to the XML crowd.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-31 05:34:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

I guess I'm fine with the way this is until v3.  I seriously doubt anyone is relying on the current cells extension format, however."}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2013-06-03 03:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
API to get the Cell Capacity

The total RAM and the available RAM are stored in memory of CellStateManager.
This API gets the available slots per flavor for a given cell.

Implements: blueprint get-cell-free-ram
Change-Id: I2a6dbb8835cad04f3ee058c3012490782d7c8e67

(8 inline comments)

Beside the inline comments there are general ones:
1. I think we don't need separate plugin to implement multi-vendor support.
2. It seems that we don't need no-op driver because even driver for current implementation has to do some interaction with agent.

I have a patch which decouples driver logic of "reference implementation" from a plugin. 
It would be nice to have abstract driver from your patch to be merged before I submit my patch.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Eugene
As you probably know this patch is "step0" of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/quantum/+spec/multi-vendor-support-for-lbaas.
In the next step the original plugin will be removed and there will be only one lbaas plugin.
The noop driver is used for testing purposes and may be a good starting point for vendors who wish to implement their own driver.
Can you please elaborate about your patch - which BP is backing it?'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

TestLoadBalancerPluginNotificationWrapper was removed because it tests the following mechanism :
When a vip is created/updated/deleted it causes the following method calls in the class 'LoadBalancerAgentApi' - destroy_pool and reload_pool
This is a specific behavior of the Grizzly plugin and was removed from the Havana plugin.
The behavior in Havana plugin is to invoke the driver for vip creation/deletion/updating"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Restored

reverify'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 7590, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Hi Avishay,

Need the Old Values for the updates for the following scenarios.

VIP Update:
When pool_id is updated, we need the old pool_id associated with the VIP to unbind the members of the old pool with the vip and bind the members of the new pool id with the vip

Member Update:
When pool_id is updated, we need the old pool_id to unbind the health monitors and vip for this member for the old pool and bind to the health monitors and vip of the updated pool.'}, {'account_id': 7590, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Builds for me.

Requires following support on the Plugin Side and Plugin Driver API for the Vendor Device Driver.

- Update APIs in Plugin Driver should take both old values and new values.
 
- Update API Plugin Implementation should retrieve the old value before calling the update of DB in order to pass the old values to the plugin driver.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Make the datetime utility function coerce to UTC

Getting datetime objects from existing sources (i.e. sqlalchemy)
is problematic because they're "timezone naive". Make the utility
function coerce these to UTC for easier conversion.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I61bc6b13f9bd9441d64cc6930e43e921af72a342

Few small notes, hope they help.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-05-30 20:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

haven't gotten much change to look at this yet, but

locations should be a sub-resource of the particular image resource.

POST /images/locations/{image id} -> POST /images/{image id}/locations"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-05-31 16:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I kinda think we should be targeting a different use case here, namely:

"As an admin, I want to optimize the performance of downloading an image by making multiple copies of the same image data available, where each copy is expected to be 'better' for a different subset of image clients."

In order to make that story work, we need multiple locations in glance and client code that is capable of auto-negotiating based on some criteria.

To keep the multiple locations part simple, I think we should hide behind the fact that the admin is a consenting adult who we should allow to do dangerous things. With that in mind, I believe multiple images should be done like registering an image in v1. Namely, you just specify the location bits, and glance trusts that is correct. This is extra good, because some of the relevant locality an admin might want to leverage cannot be captured by the url scheme of the store name completely. For example, suppose I want to specify a swift deployment that is closer than the default one. If I use "swift", I will just get the default swift deployment, but if I give the full location "swift://someotherauthurl/blah/image" then it works.

With that feature in mind, I'd like to see this changeset rewritten to extend "PATCH" semantics to the image location for admins. So to add a location, you'd do

PATCH /v2/images/abcd
[
  {"op": "add", "path": "/locations/-", "value": "swift://foo/bar"}
]

I understand and would like us to ignore for now that this feature is a bit un-user-friendly. But I'm curious to hear feedback, especially about how we can come up with ways to make it safer and more user friendly. Are there any dependencies we need before we can charge ahead (I'm especially thinking about whether or not we need to make image locations objects with extra details now, rather than just url-like entities. Also, do we need to move checksums down into location objects?)'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-05-31 18:43:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Iccha: Good catch, it never does get set.  I have it there as a 'future feature'.  For now it would only copy from the first location.

Paul: thanks for your keen eye, good comments.

I think I am going to stall out this front and start with the approach that markwash outlined."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:26:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Abandoned

Taking a substantially (ala markwash's comments) different angle on this so I am abandoning this change."}]

[{'created': '2013-05-25 01:02:26.000000000', 'message': 'A means to add and remove additional image locations.

This patch adds two new API calls:

1) POST /images/locations/{image id}
   This command takes an image ID and a store name (url scheme).
   It will copy the data stored in the primary location into the
   store of the given name.  Glance must be enabled with the given
   storage system type.  For example, if an image was uploaded and
   stored in swift, this API call could be used to replicate that
   file into the S3 storage system.

2) DELETE /images/locations/{image id}
   This call will delete the specified URL which must be in the given
   images multiple locations list.  The data will be deleted from the
   storage system.

Change-Id: Iccaf669e2f1ed9df27210146ac95a26a16546cda

commit_message:
A means to add and remove additional image locations.

This patch adds two new API calls:

1) POST /images/locations/{image id}
   This command takes an image ID and a store name (url scheme).
   It will copy the data stored in the primary location into the
   store of the given name.  Glance must be enabled with the given
   storage system type.  For example, if an image was uploaded and
   stored in swift, this API call could be used to replicate that
   file into the S3 storage system.

2) DELETE /images/locations/{image id}
   This call will delete the specified URL which must be in the given
   images multiple locations list.  The data will be deleted from the
   storage system.

Change-Id: Iccaf669e2f1ed9df27210146ac95a26a16546cda
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

commit_message:
Use - instead of . for physical_resource_name delim.

Avoiding using . means that instance hostnames are unique within the stack
(and within the tenant).

This solves 2 real-world use cases:
- tripleo issue, as described in bug: #1184713
- OpenShift template resorts to setting the hostname to ec2_instance_id

This may have an impact on users who are scripting to assume . delimiting,
however this will only affect newly created stacks after this change is
deployed.

Fixes bug: #1184713

Change-Id: I5a8eb358ea9c52162eb9263b9f9e6dcf750d787b

[{'created': '2013-06-05 14:33:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect role assignment in migration.

In the case where a user has existing roles on a project running the
migration would assign those same roles to all the user's projects.

Change-Id: Ibd99bb7cf6cb84b577eca57f903abf9d48e908c1
Fixes: bug 1186128
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect role assignment in migration.

In the case where a user has existing roles on a project running the
migration would assign those same roles to all the user's projects.

Change-Id: Ibd99bb7cf6cb84b577eca57f903abf9d48e908c1
Fixes: bug 1186128

commit_message:
Fix EC2 RegisterImage ImageLocation starts with /

* Allows image location that begins with '/' during EC2 image register
* Adds relevant unit test

Fixes LP bug #1074908

Change-Id: I488b126c2079de4370823b347e80c7ec1ecc2c9f

name.

commit_message:
Add integration test option to tox

Take current version of hacking and run it on any
review.openstack.org repository. By default nova is used
  tox -eintegration
but you can pass in any project as an argument. For example:
  tox -eintegration -- openstack keystone

This deletes the project repo after the test.

Partially fixes bug 1186421

Change-Id: I796b7c734459042b1a929afb73434cba62477365

Hi Laura,

Thanks for doing this work!
I have some minor comments inline - I also have found whitespaces and tabs, but I do not know what's the policy for them in docs. (in code they're evil!).

Also, quantum now supports XML (this is very recent news).
You might want to checkout XML support. There's not yet a patch for the API doc around, but you can try it yourself by using the quantum CLI with --request-format xml option.

For instance here's a create network response:

<subnets quantum:type="list" />
<name>ciao2</name><tenant_id>4be6b806faa0491eb358018bbe9f0d4e</tenant_id>
<admin_state_up quantum:type="bool">True</admin_state_up>
<shared quantum:type="bool">False</shared>

commit_message:
Add Quantum API v2 doc support to API site.

Modified: src/docbkx/api-ref.xml > to render new chapter and sections
New wadls in netconn-api folder: os-networks.wadl
os-ports.wadl
os-subnets.wadl
Some samples were taken from netconn-api repo and others are new.
Fixes: bug 1075811

Change-Id: I15cb4f0d0b998b7b88ea4e0f44843056a4cfd880

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-05 17:35:26.000000000', 'message': "Update NovaException's `message` attr

`NovaException` objects get a chance to override
the `message` field on a per-object basis by
passing a custom value in via the `__init__`. This
means that when we `repr` the exception, we'll see
this custom message. However, counterintuitively,
if we inspect the `message` attribute of the
exception object, we'll see the *class* default
value of message not the *instance's* custom
value.

For clarity, it makes sense for `repr` on the
exception to match the `message` value, so the
solution is to update `message` when this value is
overridden.

Fixes bug 1187872

Change-Id: I57fa0fa093f94c6648525fe16a7d9ab700a7a03d
"}]
commit_message:
Update NovaException's `message` attr

`NovaException` objects get a chance to override
the `message` field on a per-object basis by
passing a custom value in via the `__init__`. This
means that when we `repr` the exception, we'll see
this custom message. However, counterintuitively,
if we inspect the `message` attribute of the
exception object, we'll see the *class* default
value of message not the *instance's* custom
value.

For clarity, it makes sense for `repr` on the
exception to match the `message` value, so the
solution is to update `message` when this value is
overridden.

Fixes bug 1187872

Change-Id: I57fa0fa093f94c6648525fe16a7d9ab700a7a03d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-05 20:43:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't require an admin user if there isn't a need.

This change makes it possible to skip specifying if a user has to be
an admin or not as in some contexts it may not matter. Found while
trying to run the tests against an environment where my Nova user

commit_message:
Don't require an admin user if there isn't a need.

This change makes it possible to skip specifying if a user has to be
an admin or not as in some contexts it may not matter. Found while
trying to run the tests against an environment where my Nova user
worked only for the Nova MGMT api.

implements blueprint tests-should-not-require-admin-prop
Change-Id: Ief62d47216b6366e36fd90e86baf81172e5281ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-05 12:35:53.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly install install_requires.

Using the old distutils class to get non-egg installs means that we
wind up skipping the part where dependencies are processed. To combat
that, processs the dependencies ourselves. In the future, we should
replace this with code that uses pip instead of easy_install.

Change-Id: Id5465766f762ab37f121ee3d72a82098654e30db
'}, {'created': '2013-06-05 12:44:43.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly install install_requires.

PBR uses distutils.install instead of setuptools.install to provide
non-egg based installs. This is effectively the same behavior as the
--single-version-externally-managed flag to setuptools, which is what
distro packagers use inside of debs and rpms. We do this so that we
can do things like install manpages and config files.

Unfortunately, this has the unintended consequence of completely
skipping dependency processing.

Add the logic from distribute into our install class to ensure that
the contents of install_requires are installed appropriately.

In the future, we'll want to replace this method with one that uses
pip instead of easy_install. Since we're doing the work now in our
code, we might as well do it well.

Change-Id: Id5465766f762ab37f121ee3d72a82098654e30db
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly install install_requires.

PBR uses distutils.install instead of setuptools.install to provide
non-egg based installs. This is effectively the same behavior as the
--single-version-externally-managed flag to setuptools, which is what
distro packagers use inside of debs and rpms. We do this so that we
can do things like install manpages and config files.

Unfortunately, this has the unintended consequence of completely
skipping dependency processing.

Add the logic from distribute into our install class to ensure that
the contents of install_requires are installed appropriately.

In the future, we'll want to replace this method with one that uses
pip instead of easy_install. Since we're doing the work now in our
code, we might as well do it well.

Change-Id: Id5465766f762ab37f121ee3d72a82098654e30db

LGTM, I was just about to push this up :) 

One question I have, does it matter if we sync just one part of the rpc module from Oslo or should we be syncing everything from the rpc module at once? Just thinking about the case where a patch may have touched several parts of rpc in Oslo but only including one file in a Nova change might not include the functionality that file may be dependent on in Oslo. That might not pertain to this patch as the Qpid stuff was pretty isolated by Ben Nemec when he wrote it, just a general question I guess. Thanks again!'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-06-05 16:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-05 16:07:34.000000000', 'message': 'Update rpc/impl_qpid.py from oslo

The current qpid driver cannot serialize objects containing strings
longer than 65535 characters.  This just became a breaking issue when
the message to scheduler_run_instance went over that limit.  The fix has
been commited to oslo, so this just syncs it over to Nova.

Bug 1175808
Bug 1187595

Change-Id: If95c11a7e03c81d89133f6cad0dcbb6d8acb8148
'}]
commit_message:
Update rpc/impl_qpid.py from oslo

The current qpid driver cannot serialize objects containing strings
longer than 65535 characters.  This just became a breaking issue when
the message to scheduler_run_instance went over that limit.  The fix has
been commited to oslo, so this just syncs it over to Nova.

Bug 1175808
Bug 1187595

Change-Id: If95c11a7e03c81d89133f6cad0dcbb6d8acb8148

commit_message:
Only lookup volume service passwords when necessary

The volume service passwords should be looked up depending on
the type of driver used.  As I understand it the grizzly netapp
driver no longer requires dfm.  However, without testing this,
would like to keep the existing configuraton.  We will be testing
this in our lab over the next few days, and will send a new patch
based on our findings.

Change-Id: I1cf0b6e292eec71788d0b79dbf270a1d17bbfa1e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-04 21:34:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a race condition in test_create_delete_image()

The delete portion test_create_delete_image() in
ImagesOneServerTest has a race condition between the delete
and the assertRaises(). This commit fixes this by enabling
wait_for_resource_deletion() for the images_client and using that
after the delete request.

Fixes Bug 1187566

Change-Id: I13114d6c549756b3d753c9395f82d58cbaec04db
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a race condition in test_create_delete_image()

The delete portion test_create_delete_image() in
ImagesOneServerTest has a race condition between the delete
and the assertRaises(). This commit fixes this by enabling
wait_for_resource_deletion() for the images_client and using that
after the delete request.

Fixes Bug 1187566

Change-Id: I13114d6c549756b3d753c9395f82d58cbaec04db

commit_message:
Delete unused bin directory

Delete last bits of bin/.  With the move to entrypoints these aren't
needed anymore.

Update CONF.bindir to default to
  os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'local', 'bin')

Part of blueprint entrypoints-plugins

Change-Id: I95250d3779433e7b85aaa889a873b16c86a7d2be

commit_message:
xenapi: Added logging for sparse copy

After 300 seconds(default), logs how many bytes have been written
already, and how many are left, so as to be able to track progress of
the long running task.
Implements blueprint log-progress-of-sparse-copy

Change-Id: I289ab978ec4b31f1015c783111c01a460de33f09

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-31 12:10:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt

Within Havana we generally rename tools/pip-requires to
requirements.txt and tools/test-requires to test-requirements.txt.

Handle both locations gracefully.

Fix flake8 warnings.

Change-Id: I5ad03a1b7efa76e31522f5b6f0da1bb3dd8cf6bc
'}]
commit_message:
Update requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt

Within Havana we generally rename tools/pip-requires to
requirements.txt and tools/test-requires to test-requirements.txt.

Handle both locations gracefully.

Fix flake8 warnings.

Change-Id: I5ad03a1b7efa76e31522f5b6f0da1bb3dd8cf6bc

commit_message:
WIP DO NOT MERGE, testing smokestack

Add jsonutils.to_primitive around an image object before sending over
RPC to the scheduler.

Logging instance and request_spec to see where the 68527 value is coming
from.

Updated impl_qpid from olso in case it's related to 1175808.

Testing for bug 1187595

Change-Id: Icc3ccf9ab95c8f75dcc35ca7b9fe737daa34b2f9

commit_message:
Add ssh power manager.

Converting nova's virtual_power_manager for use by ironic

Implements: blueprint virtual-power-driver.

Change-Id: Ie24564e349aca863578955385f084f1be8b0b053
Authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Corrected syntax to actually work under grizzly

The file contained a syntax error in `[pipeline:apiversions]`.
Also, the `[openstack_volume_api_v1]` section was incorrect.
Verified this template correctly starts a grizzly cinder-api
instance.

Change-Id: I8408aaa1bcaad3a3ebba2a666dc29d950866ea02

commit_message:
More python3 compatibility.

* pbr/packaging.py: Properly convert bytes into unicode strings and back
to bytes again. Replace os.path.walk() with os.walk().

* pbr/tests/__init__.py: Remove use of mox.

* pbr/tests/moxstubout.py: Remove use of mox.

* pbr/tests/test_setup.py: Use bytestrings instead of str or unicode
when performing IO.

* pbr/tests/test_version.py: Remove use of oslo.config.

* requirements.txt: Pin jinja2 to version compatible with python3.2.

* test-requirements.txt: Remove oslo.config and mox.

Change-Id: I9b5a32d7204fa2af56ecf4fdcf6b6da3bbb03200

This adds the ignore, show source, and exclude parameters that are
used in tox.ini for flake8 to run_tests.sh. This will make running

Change-Id: I91d53750a591c79b5e9a820bc31497bac148c0a1

commit_message:
Make pep8 checks in run_tests.sh match tox.

This adds the ignore, show source, and exclude parameters that are
used in tox.ini for flake8 to run_tests.sh. This will make running
pep8 with run_tests.sh consistent with the gate checks.

Change-Id: I91d53750a591c79b5e9a820bc31497bac148c0a1

commit_message:
Tests should be using require_relative

The #require_relative statement is relative to the file
containing the the statement.

Change-Id: I032eb8384328fb478e12b6f433d3cfa2229e252a

commit_message:
Improve Python 3.x compatibility

Mechanical translation of the deprecated
except x,y: construct with except x as y:
The latter works with any Python >= 2.6.
Add Hacking check.

Change-Id: I845829d97d379c1cd9b3a77e7e5786586f263b64

commit_message:
Changes to NVP plugin configuration file

Tweak devstack support to the nicira plugin in order to
reflect changes made in:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26427

This complements fixes for bug #1121605

Change-Id: I221466fb40412ceb457d3e888767291a76176aa6

commit_message:
Create nodegroup template flow implementation.

Plugins and hadoop versions are taken from api.
All processes and configurations are stubbed.
Version dropdown is managed by javascript.
Validation fixed.
Minor refactoring.

Change-Id: I9229c567492e1c5362e8c21295ad5fb15fca8533

commit_message:
Resizing a server by means of changing its flavor

Sometime we need resize the server when it is launched, such as the number of vcpu, the size of memory and the size of disk.
We can achieve this by means of changing its flavor.

Change-Id: I1ab6b61f286e951b644a2e66383ac62c6a6f887e
Implements: blueprint resize-server

commit_message:
Add fedora support for ramdisk-image-create.

This patch allows the creation of ramdisks from a fedora system.

Change-Id: Ic3b393af45ae1b85d015d2ceb5601ea723457da6

[{'created': '2013-05-31 16:53:19.000000000', 'message': "Don't delete sys_meta on instance delete

Unfortunately, we require to access instance_system_metadata to get
data (specifically at least instance_type data) for instances that have
been deleted.

There's 2 cases where this is true:

1) nova-api supports showing deleting instances when you specify a
'changes-since' param.
2) The _usage_audit_log periodic task pulls all instances during the
audit period, which includes instances that have been deleted during
that period.

This reverts commit 17bca438954638d74035d560e826a26a532b3ea3, which was
attempting to fix a bug where we leave instance_system_metadata entries
undeleted from the DB.  There's not an easy way to query for the deleted
sys_meta data in an efficient manner, and leaving the entries undeleted is
the lesser of the 2 evils for now.

Fixes bug 1185190

commit_message:
Don't delete sys_meta on instance delete

Unfortunately, we require to access instance_system_metadata to get
data (specifically at least instance_type data) for instances that have
been deleted.

There's 2 cases where this is true:

1) nova-api supports showing deleting instances when you specify a
'changes-since' param.
2) The _usage_audit_log periodic task pulls all instances during the
audit period, which includes instances that have been deleted during
that period.

This reverts commit 17bca438954638d74035d560e826a26a532b3ea3, which was
attempting to fix a bug where we leave instance_system_metadata entries
undeleted from the DB.  There's not an easy way to query for the deleted
sys_meta data in an efficient manner, and leaving the entries undeleted is
the lesser of the 2 evils for now.

Fixes bug 1185190

Change-Id: I898f0546c49126dcc56a4237120082f95dc82304
(cherry picked from commit 4885aa28706a1858f4fc51a0d2c661eec05139c0)

commit_message:
Set default columns in ext-list

Previously ext-list does not inherits ListCommand base class for listing
and cannot specify columns to display. This commit changes ext-list to
use ListCommand and adds a unit test for extensions.

This also changes the default value of _formatters in ListCommand to {}.
By this subclasses no longer override _formatters unless required.

Fixes bug 1161866

Change-Id: Ifd9ab54d4e84a2b7a1d7eecd67f6270ec643db1d

commit_message:
Elevate acceptors context on accept reserve udpate

When accepting a transfer we need to update the
quota data for both the donor and the acceptor's.
The acceptor is easy enough (as that's the context
we currently are using) however to update the donor's
quota data we need an elevated context.

Fixes bug: 1187538

Change-Id: I1fb9e7726830dce2c3de23d3446de5bbe9a1fd24

The doc team will soon be generating documentation for configuration

commit_message:
Add extra details in BigSwitch config

Add some details to some of the BigSwitch configuration options.

The doc team will soon be generating documentation for configuration
options by extracting it directly from the source code help strings,
which is one of the motivations for adding this detail.

Change-Id: I7c694212bee29ac78135a4436633a202a6bba4a2

Add *.swo/swp to .gitignore

one here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30648/3

Fixes bug: 1187600

commit_message:
Re-write of the cinder-manage man page.

The cinder-manage man page didn't appear to have been re-written
since splitting from Nova.  There were numerous options that
no longer exist documented and references to Nova instead of
Cinder.

This version has been re-written based on the current code in
cinder-manage.

(fixes bug 1174502)

Change-Id: Ia03ca05bbd87444b2213bf719da0ffff96b67699

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-01 12:26:37.000000000', 'message': "Handle IPv6 specifid glance servers gracefully

IPv6 netlocs can for valid reasons contain ':', so
splitting by ':' is dangerous. Instead of splitting
by host and port in order to only reassemble it into
a netloc again later, simply always pass netloc, which
avoids the bug.

Add extra textcases to verify the new behavior.
Fix Flake8 warnings.

Fixes LP Bug #1182830

Change-Id: I130528ae946e8888d35c25e468b4ea6ac29db0cf
"}]
commit_message:
Handle IPv6 specifid glance servers gracefully

IPv6 netlocs can for valid reasons contain ':', so
splitting by ':' is dangerous. Instead of splitting
by host and port in order to only reassemble it into
a netloc again later, simply always pass netloc, which
avoids the bug.

Add extra textcases to verify the new behavior.
Fix Flake8 warnings.

Fixes LP Bug #1182830

Change-Id: I130528ae946e8888d35c25e468b4ea6ac29db0cf

[{'created': '2013-05-30 23:18:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add @require_exclusive_lock decorators to ipmi.py.

Add @require_exclusive_lock decorators to the following methods of the
IPMI power driver:
- set_power_state
- reboot
- set_boot_device

Change-Id: Ic5c12ff6a399b637eccb82c6ffd7e9c575f4edc4
'}, {'created': '2013-06-04 01:36:03.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent IPMI actions from colliding.

Prevent IPMI actions from colliding with eachother, even if they are
issued to the API in parallel, by adding @require_exclusive_lock
decorators to public methods of the IPMIPowerDriver.

Change-Id: Ic5c12ff6a399b637eccb82c6ffd7e9c575f4edc4
'}, {'created': '2013-06-04 01:41:19.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent IPMI actions from colliding.

'}, {'created': '2013-06-04 15:24:57.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent IPMI actions from colliding.

issued to the API in parallel, by adding @require_exclusive_lock

commit_message:
Prevent IPMI actions from colliding.

Prevent IPMI actions from colliding with eachother, even if they are
issued to the API in parallel, by adding @require_exclusive_lock
decorators to public methods of the IPMIPowerDriver.

Change-Id: Ic5c12ff6a399b637eccb82c6ffd7e9c575f4edc4

This uses Socket.io to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

Run the server with `./manage.py runserver_socketio`. Note that it
currently doesn't add or delete instances: to test it, have a few
instances launched already, navigate to /projects/instances/ and then
change their state (e.g. by stopping them) out of band (in another
browser tab or via the command line).

The bulk of the functionality is in horizon.realtime.js (client) and
openstack_dashboard/realtime.py (server).

commit_message:
Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses Socket.io to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

Run the server with `./manage.py runserver_socketio`. Note that it
currently doesn't add or delete instances: to test it, have a few
instances launched already, navigate to /projects/instances/ and then
change their state (e.g. by stopping them) out of band (in another
browser tab or via the command line).

The bulk of the functionality is in horizon.realtime.js (client) and
openstack_dashboard/realtime.py (server).

Change-Id: Ia3dccd6e3bc36290df02e8b9835ace5a169760b9
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

[{'created': '2013-05-24 16:38:53.000000000', 'message': "Add gevent-socketio dependencies

This adds the gevent-socketio Python deps, the JavaScript Socket.io
client and a manage.py commmand for running the socketio-enhanced web
server (unfortunately, it's not fully backwards compatible with WSGI so
the sockets don't work over mod_wsgi).

Change-Id: I2bd0e6da5e13c3b7cf24617b09866cd112890086
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Add gevent-socketio dependencies

This adds the gevent-socketio Python deps, the JavaScript Socket.io
client and a manage.py commmand for running the socketio-enhanced web
server (unfortunately, it's not fully backwards compatible with WSGI so
the sockets don't work over mod_wsgi).

Change-Id: I2bd0e6da5e13c3b7cf24617b09866cd112890086
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/29853/3/check/gate-python-reddwarfclient-pep8/154 : SUCCESS in 3m 27s
- http://logs.openstack.org/29853/3/check/gate-python-reddwarfclient-python26/153 : SUCCESS in 2m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/29853/3/check/gate-python-reddwarfclient-python27/153 : SUCCESS in 1m 25s
'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The int-tests expect a dictionary because when I changed the client to return a dictionary for show I changed them as well. :)

If the cli's list call is failing, then it needs to be fixed to work with a list of dictionaries."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I believe we should fix the CLI to handle dictionaries. I'm sorry that it broke when I changed it. Additionally, we need to write some tests specifically targeting the CLI."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If you strongly feel this should be returning an object and not a dictionary, bring it up for discussion during the next Reddwarf meeting. Maybe people disagree with me and would like to see this call return an object. 

I stated my reasons for changing the return type to a dictionary in my original commit and over IRC at the time, but maybe I wasn't clear enough. At the time, the object returned was worse than what you're presenting now, because users were forced to access the "_info" dictionary of an object. 

However, I still think using a dictionary makes sense, even though the resource object you've made now correctly accesses the underlying quota resources.

This API basically returns a mapping of resource names to number. This collection of resource names is designed to be flexible and subject to change over time. If you think about writing API docs, we'd never say "all this will only ever return instances and volumes," we'd speak more generally and say "this returns a mapping of resources, which currently includes instances and volumes." That way we wouldn't have to update the docs each time we added a new resource type to quotas.

The type which best represents this situation is a dictionary. Classes are better when the attributes they contain are going to be semi-permanent. A dictionary signals that the collection is dynamic and the user shouldn't hard code keys into their application. For example, if Horizon used the client, they would be more prone to design a page to view quotas to simply show a generic collection of resources, rather than a page which only showed "instances" and "volumes." In other words, a dictionary is the more correct type because it drives the thinking we want around quotas.

Currently the set operation uses a dictionary, not the new resource type. I believe this proves my point - Vipul even asked when Quotas was being created to make sure the user didn't have to input *all* the resources each time they set the quotas. Again, a dictionary makes more sense on the set. If a Resource subclass instance was used we'd end up setting the majority of attributes to None.

Third, it is more symmetrical to return a dictionary since that is what you use to set quotas. 

I realize that this makes the CLI tool a bit harder to write, but I don't think that matters because it's more important the code people (including us) can write with python-reddwarfclient is clear. Since I think returning a dictionary is more clear the extra line or two it will take to fix the CLI isn't that meaningful to me.'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

I don't understand this change. Can you show me a recreate of where this failed?

I don't want quotas to return an object with attributes for instances and volumes, because it implies what gets returned is nailed down, when in fact it may change to include more resources over time.

Also, I like the fact that you set quotas using a dictionary, and retrieve it with one. That's more symmetrical than getting back and object, but then having to make a dictionary to set it. That's my two cents."}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

lets chat about it in #reddwarf. id like to know the pros/cons'}, {'account_id': 5390, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5390, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Tim, this is the error you get when an admin tries to query the quota for a particular tenant.

https://gist.github.com/anonymous/5623524

This is due to the fact that the return data is not of type "Resource". So it fails trying to get the _info value.

The other APIs returns the data inside a Resource object.

BTW, the int-tests will fail because the int-tests assumes a dict coming back, which is the bug. So if this is merged, the fix for the int-tests has to be merged right after (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29860/)'}, {'account_id': 5390, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Tim, but all other cli calls return the results as a Resource type. Dont we want the quota cli to stay consistent as well. So instead of returning a dict, we return a Resource which contains the dict?'}, {'account_id': 5390, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Tim,

My apologies. I was not aware that you made this changes explicitly recently. I thought it was a bug that i left when i worked on the quota feature.

I am not against the work you are proposing (converting CLI to return dicts), I just thought it wasn't consistent with the way other CLI commands handles the results. Other CLI commands return the result data in a Resource type object. Quota command returns its result in a dict.

But like i said, if i knew you made this change purposely, i wouldn't have fixed it this way.

But it seems that if we do want CLI to return results as dictionaries, there is more work to be done. Currently the CLI pipeline expects a Resource type object to be returned and not a dict. Thus causing the CLI to fail."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

so adding another server create for just this call seems weird. Is there another class where this could go to not take the extra server create?"}, {'account_id': 6719, 'date': '2013-05-28 13:12:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi,
Thank You for the good point,
from the one hand I absolutely agree with you,
but from the other one,lets  discuss this. action(list_servers_for_all_tenants) is available for admin only. So that's why I put such test into admin package. That's ok. I we walk trough exists test, we could see that there is separate tests modules for each business objects like aggregates, services, quotas etc. So if I'll add such tests there - it would be strange why action list servers verifies in tests, that tested quotas(as example). There are another places in tempest where actions with servers are tested such api.compute.servers, but there are no any tests with admin(as I understand we especially created package admin for such tests). Of course it is strange to see that we create instance to run 1 test on it, but may be in feature I'll gather all action  with vm that admin only can do and will test them in this module. One thing that I want to add for this patch - that rebase needed :)"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-05 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Add more test cases.

Change _create_volume()'s signature and add two more test cases.  One is `test_check_attach`, another is `test_check_detach`. Both can be found in `test_volume.py`.

Change-Id: Ifb5adb5e0504588272596fc22a019c9f60ef7f3b

"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-05-20 19:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

One question I have. log.py requires notifier, local, jsonutils, etc... A couple of those modules don't really seem like they lie within the realm of this change. So, how acceptable is it to pull in those dependencies in this change in order to pass Jenkins? I know I will be using notifier in the future to implement the following blueprint: 
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/notifications

But I like to keep things relatively isolated when it comes to pushing things to review instead of pushing up a bunch of dependencies. Here I think importing log.py is required under the definition of the change, but what about notifier (which also pulls in rpc as a dependency), and local, etc? Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-05-21 14:46:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think it sucks that oslo introduces all those interdependencies, but the issue is technically out of scope for keystone. I'd suggest adding whatever you need from oslo in a discrete patch and making this patch dependent on that (or if it's a trivial change, just do it here)."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-05-21 14:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ok, that makes sense. I can use this patch here to incorporate what we need from oslo and then introduce the changes in a separate patch. The changes I made to get logging to work at pretty minor.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-05-21 15:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Also, remove "WORKINPROGRESS" from the commit message, and mark the review as Work In Progress using the corresponding button. revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-20 18:29:33.000000000', 'message': "Unified logging strategy from oslo-incubator

This commit introduces a unified logging strategy from oslo-incubator in
an attempt to standardize logging in Keystone similar to other OpenStack
projects (Nova, Quantum, etc.). This commit keeps
keystone/common/config.py as a wrapper to
keystone/openstack/common/log.py
but instead of carrying out logging setup in config.py it calls into
setup() within log.py.

This change contains changes from oslo-incubator to existing files in
Keystone, in which those files were sync'd. (WORKINPROGRESS)

blueprint unified-logging-in-keystone

Change-Id: I9f7072dcbbb4609fa573501a9f2b55e8849b790a
"}, {'created': '2013-05-20 18:31:38.000000000', 'message': "Unified logging strategy from oslo-incubator

projects (Nova, Quantum, etc.). This commit keeps

but instead of carrying out logging setup in config.py it calls into
setup() within log.py.

Keystone, in which those files were sync'd. (WORKINPROGRESS)
